 | Such a masterpiece. 10/10 would play again. 100% this game just isn't enough the greed in me wants more. THANK YOU!!!

Graphics are nice, Gameplay is nice. This game has a lot of identity which is super nice, but as far as i am concerned it has a lot of bugs that can make you lose without your fault, you can produce double the energy you need and still have blackouts, factories randomly not producing goods (in my case it was procesed food and it went from above 200 to 0 in one turn), it's such a shame that such a good idea as mix of democracy and civilization, with rogue lite mechanics setteled in middle east to be broken, apparently devs abandoned this game and the studio propably has problems existing | На удивление приятная игра, которую с удовольствием прошёл несколько раз, включая сверхмаксимальный уровень сложности. Начнём с того, что может не понравится некоторым игрокам:
1. Игра точно мотивирует пройти её несколько раз, при том, что она является сюжетной. Мотивирует ачивками, открытием новых министров, бонусами на следующие прохождения, невозможностью увидеть всё за один раз. Могут ли там быть разные концовки? Да, немного разные концовки могут быть, в зависимости от некоторых решений в процессе президентства, но вариантов их там не много. Игра в любом случае, закончится после двух президентских сроков [spoiler](если быть совсем точным, второй раз выиграть выборы придётся для достижения хотя бы относительно позитивного итога, но третий срок отсиживать уже не придётся из-за определённого ключевого события, которое случится буквально через несколько месяцев после второй победы на выборах)[/spoiler], поэтому сравнивать её с политическими бесконечными песочницами совершенно нельзя. С другой стороны, у меня не было ощущения, что я хочу продолжить дальше, то есть мне было интересно ровно до того момента, когда как раз концовка и наступает - именно в этот момент понимаешь, что хочешь закончить. Так что какой-никакой приятный баланс тут соблюдён, просто не факт, что всем игрокам захочется играть многократно.
2. Игра не представляет собой слишком глубокую симуляцию политических процессов, то есть не стоит ждать от неё чего-то масштабов «Tropico». Но в то же время она не представляет собой и быстро надоедающий симулятор иконок, связей и табличек, вроде «Democracy», где подвигал всё везде в нужную тебе сторону и радуйся - смысла в ней сидеть дольше часа больше нет. Игра и тут успешно балансирует где-то между... поэтому может не зайти любителям либо одного, либо другого. Она не пытается быть серьёзной, но она может быть такой. Она не пытается быть хардкорной, но называть её казуальной - язык не поворачивается.

Теперь то, что точно может быть приятно в этом политическом симуляторе:
1. В нём требуется балансировать между разными регионами страны, где могут быть сильно разные люди с разными потребностями. Учитывая то, что игра каждое новое прохождение генерирует карту (да, карта там не статичная - она при каждой новой игре будет немного разной, её генерацию можно настраивать: другие ресурсы, другие ключевые точки, другое физическое состояние страны, другие опасные места, другие соседи и тому подобное), то регионы тоже могут поменяться. Смотришь налево - там огромный сельхозрегион с лугами и сёлами, где верят в странную местную религию; смотришь в центр - там небольшой урбанизированный регион с огромными городами, где преобладает уже образованное либеральное городское население; смотришь направо - там вообще горный регион, где население преимущественно составляет этническое меньшинство, которое вообще не против отделиться от страны, вот только там у них выход к морю и главный порт в стране... И, при каждой генерации, подобные региональные вызовы меняются. И, если уж не всех этих разных людей с разными желаниями, то хотя бы большинство, надо удовлетворить к выборам, иначе не победить.
2. Механики и геймплей достаточно масштабны, чтобы их можно было похвалить: тут таблицы и графики, ползунки бюджетов и прочие элементы, которые любят хардкорщики; тут и строительство ключевых зданий и нужных местах, прокладка дорог и транспортная логистика, любимые градостроителями; тут и постоянные политические дилеммы, которые надо разрешать, так любимые казуальщиками. Кажется, игра пыталась сесть сразу на все стулья. И, кажется, у неё даже получилось, потому что ничего из этого нет так много, чтобы задушить. Оно всё как-то органично сменяет друг друга на экране игрока.
3. Игра изобилует разными необычными фишками: видеовставки, некоторый юмор, невероятные случайные события... всё это дополнительного разноображивает геймплей и механики, которые и без того, достаточно широки. Настолько широки, что в некоторых вещах стоит даже поискать гайды или спрашивать у игравшего друга, что делать.

Итог: я однозначно могу сказать, что игра мне понравилась и видно, как разработчики старались наполнить её контентом. И, пусть она не получилась масштабов глобальных стратегий от «Paradox», где игроки запускают сотни разных каток и сидят в них тысячи часов, игра правда может иногда напомнить о себе и заставить пройти новую катку. Было бы даже интересно посмотреть, что бы получилось у разработчиков, если бы у них были бюджеты и сроки на создание глобальной стратегии. Я бы с удовольствием такое увидел. На фоне позитивных эмоций от игры тонут некоторые ошибки локализации, не очень удобное управление войсками и редкие вылеты, но не сказать про это, не могу (пусть те, кто сочтёт нужным прочесть этот обзор, будут в курсе их наличия). Но эта игра заслужила, чтобы я проигнорировал огрехи и играл несколько раз, потому что она хотела быть не такой, как все. Я не знаю, придутся ли кому-то всё эти креативы по душе ещё, но игра точно достойна ознакомления с ней и покупки (тем более на неё бывают огромные скидки по 80%). | Overly complicated slide juggler and builder that feels more like whack-a-mole than a 4x strategy. | Best. Cutscenes. Ever.

Really interesting albeit a little tedious at times strategy game too.

Honestly, after completing a run. It's buggy, but it's still one of the best art pieces of gaming I've ever seen. Seeing that its been sold off is absolutely depressing. | Egy kellemes kis agyhalott Szaddam, Khadafi, stb szimulátor. Néhány ponton olyan rossz, hogy az már jó! Ne várj tőle sokat és fizess érte sokat! (mondjuk alapból sem olyan nagy az ára!) És elég jól visszaadja a harmadik világ abszurditásának érzését.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, Simulation, Strategy, Free To Play
Reviews: 我看到游戏更新了中文，但在游戏里找不到中文设置在哪里。或者根本没有中文。 | I have zero complaints about this game. It's great. It's free. The biggest 'issue' with it is more players don't play it. but it's a great game.

This is the best game that I can't recommend. The shooting, the art, the sound—everything about it is the industry's best, held back by draconian progression systems and temporary-by-design story content. I imagine this game is comparable to something like heroin: it feels [i]so good[/i]... until it doesn't. And then you're stuck chasing the dragon. No other developer exhibits such frustrating inconsistency of quality and consideration for its players. The future of this live service game is uncertain, and that's a real shame because I'm pretty sure nothing will ever be as good as this game can be, could have been, should have been. | I... Just can't anymore.
When Bungie actually puts in effort into their game (Aka, major DLC's minus lightfall) the game is amazing, but the amount of times they have dropped the ball, especially with this last episode/season has finally done it for me. I've followed Destiny since the original on the xbox 360, became a fan of the story, and continued on into Destiny 2 back when they were still part of activision on battlenet. I've always attempted to keep good faith and put in a good word even when the game was at a low point, but now after having the saint-14 and osiris gay love story interjected and shoved down my throat multiple times, the last season "echos" big bad guy get one shot in a cutscene and escape by floating down a vex "milk" river, and now the current episode which started by reusing a game mode that they butchered and made worse than the original which was still in the game and the other gamemode that came later which was decent but had loot that you could get just by running around in the standard maps made it not at all worth doing. Compound that with the tonic system that relied on Strict RNG to get new tonics which were necessary to get further in the reputation system and played a minimal part in the over arching story and took forever just to get three tonics out of DOZENS WHICH BARELY WORKED AND WAS ON A TIMER THAT YOU HAD TO MICRO MANAGE ON TOP OF OTHER MICRO MANAGING SYSTEMS.... yeah it was just TOO MUCH.  The final nail in the coffin was the fact that we found out just how much work they put into the seasonal / episodic content which normally is spread out when they gave it all at one time. By the way you could do all 3 parts of revenant in less than 3 hours which for something that you pay for is absolutely Pathetic. For comparison Warframe Is completely 100% FREE and has proven to have a better player experience, impactful story, developers that actually care, better visuals, smaller file size, did not take paid content away forever (yes that happened in destiny), and more. 

I loved this game because it's story at one point was amazing and now... it's a chore.  Combine all that with the current state of the company's choices and behaviors, it's just not worth trying to keep the rose tinted glasses on and support it anymore.  I loved this game.... and I just feel betrayed and disappointed.  Call me a Schill, say I'm coping, or a hater I no longer care. Like many said Destiny was the only thing that could Kill Destiny, and well they did it.  I'm done supporting Bungie until they get their collective heads out of their ass.

Edit as to Toasty's comments, I don't care if Osiris and Saint are gay, I care that the fact that they are gay is more of a Slap to the face and is way too frequent as a main story beat, it's not subtle like other characters and kept in the background as an aspect of the character which would have made the first Episode much more impactful story wise. As Toasty mentioned Warframe has these notions and explores it but it's subtle and not in  your face and distracting from the overall story which is why I exemplify it's story over This one. Take that as you will but I stand with my choice and opinion, don't be assholes just because you disagree and have a different opinion. | 10 year veteran of the franchise. this new season brings to me the unfortunate realization its over. the game had the most amazing expansion in its history, just to turn around and fire loads of staff. bungie vets who made this series what it is (was practically) are gone, and you can feel it. new season with no exotic armor at all, mediocre activity that is just the same recycled event, with recycled modifiers from older content that is extremely tiring, just cus it worked once doesnt mean they need to do it 3 or so times. the sandbox is in a pretty great state, but the creativity of the team is dying out, and the lack of employees and budget is extremely obvious. Pete Parsons is directly responsible for cutting hundreds of devs and bringing this ship crashing into the ground. Destiny is genuinely unenjoyable and within the hour i was bored. this is genuinely depressing as i have thousands of hours, and thousands on psn and have loved the game through some of its lowest points. but the mediocrity of this season is killing me. i genuinely am worried this game will actually die for real within this act. | I think this is the best game ever made and it's not very close. I started playing around the time it went free to play and I'd do it again in a heartbeat. No other game does what this one does. I think everyone should get to experience what Destiny offers. This rating is positive because of what this game has meant to me, not because of what it has become.

[i]Currently:[/i]
[list]
	[*]This game is so unfairly priced that I can't genuinely recommend any of my non-Destiny friends or new players to pick it up to try it out.
	[*]The community is toxic as hell.
	[*]The game is dying, fewer and fewer people get on to play every single day.
	[*]There are cheaters in 1/3 of Crucible games (might just be caused by the dwindling player count making the concentration of cheaters higher).
	[*]Every new update is bugged (sometimes to the point of unplayability) and results in either server downtime, another update to address it (takes a month for this to get released), or Bungie just giving up and auto-completing quest steps.
	[*]The new player onboarding experience is abysmal. You're given a 5 minute cutscene to explain the story (since they completely removed the real campaign), a couple of introductory quests, and then you're kicked out of the bird's nest to do whatever your heart desires with minimal direction or suggestion on where to go. So bad, in fact, that Bungie has given up and now provides players with an option to skip it entirely since they know that if a new player is playing this game, it MUST be at the direction of another existing player telling them what to do anyway.
	[*]The game is riddled with power creep. Guardian kits are the strongest they have ever been and new aspirational content has gotten easier and easier.
[/list]

Realistically, the game needs a reset like Destiny 1 got with the release of Destiny 2, but Bungie's insistence on this being a forever game post-Final Shape has led to Destiny 3 being nothing but a pipe dream while this game wanes in its final days after the equivalent of an Avenger: Endgame story beat. Bungie just doesn't know when to let it go.

Some of my best memories are playing this game, but I just can't in good conscience say that you should start playing this game if you haven't already. You just had to be there, I guess. | 傻逼棒鸡越来越会圈钱了，年四刚出直接弃坑果然是我最聪明的一次，可惜那些没玩过年四之前的朋友们了，没去过１２１５，没见过满网都是土命２的视频，到处都是开坑教学，各种教学，生怕你不会玩，现在一问你玩什么，命运２，没听过小游戏吧，一手好牌打得稀烂，年四更新一百多G删到九十G，以前死命肝的枪年四买季票直接领东西换，删称号，删地图，删成就，现在补回来了又怎么样呢，有不少人都记得有个傻逼鸡一手好牌打稀烂，可惜年四刚玩年五刚玩的新玩家都不知道这事情，那我亲爱的朋友，现在你知道了吗，知道为什么感觉现在这么好个游戏不温不火了吗。

I love a lot of what Apex Legends has to offer. The gun play is one of the best in any game I have ever played and the charachters are very fun. However I can’t recommend the game strictly on the monetization. For example before this new season (24) there were leaked mini battle passes for all of the new legends that would add a ton of progression that was desperately needed. It would have given the players something worth playing for. But what does EA do? Make you pay 10$ for each one. This isn’t even mentioning the collection events that cost 300+ dollars to complete. They also just added a new mobile game pay system that makes you pay to unlock something cheap and then to unlock something free. All the skins are also egregiously overpriced in general. It’s all there to just make you spend as much money as possible it’s trash. They don’t really care about the players they care about the money that’s it. The balance changes are often mediocre and  don’t always fix all the problems they should. EA is lucky the foundation of this game is as good as it is otherwise people wouldn’t put up with the gross monetization. A few of the selling points are as follows:

1.Killer Campaign: It's not the longest in history, but an excellent story with a few adrenaline pumping moments and fluid gameplay. The game cleverly weaves mechanics together that never subtract, only add to the way you play.

2.Movement:This game has such a fluid movement system, it always feels like reaching a new spot to kill an enemy always feels possible. The transitions are smooth and intuitive

3. Gunplay- Amazing set of firearms that readily invite plenty of customization. The guns feel good to shoot and never feel clunky

4.MECHS- I for one am obsessed with mechs, and this game really scratches the itch. The titan classes are both fun and interesting to learn, each with their own personality in multiplayer

Respawn, if you're listening... I will gladly support a titanfall 3 if it ever comes to surface.

10/10 Titanfalls | Titanfall 2 is nothing short of a gem in the world of first-person shooters, blending fluid mechanics, engaging storytelling, and thrilling mech-based combat into one unforgettable package. Released in 2016, it stands as a testament to how innovation in game design can produce something truly special. However, despite its brilliance, the game now faces challenges in its multiplayer landscape, largely due to being overshadowed by its battle royale sibling, Apex Legends.

[h1]Campaign: A Perfectly Executed Storyline[/h1]
One of the standout features of Titanfall 2 is its campaign mode, which is widely regarded as one of the best in FPS history. The story revolves around Jack Cooper, a humble rifleman who unexpectedly forms a bond with a Vanguard-class Titan, BT-7274, after his pilot is killed in action. Their journey together is emotional, exciting, and filled with clever twists. The dynamic between Jack and BT brings heart to the narrative, making the story more than just a vehicle for the action.
Each mission introduces new mechanics that keep the gameplay fresh, from wall-running platforming challenges to time-travel puzzles. The creativity behind these sequences ensures that every level feels unique, culminating in a finale that will leave you in awe.

[h1]Gameplay: Smooth, Fast, and Addictive[/h1]
Titanfall 2's gameplay is its crown jewel. The movement mechanics are unmatched, offering fast-paced wall-running, double-jumping, and parkour-like traversal that feels incredibly fluid and rewarding. Whether you’re darting across walls in a tight gunfight or dropping into a Titan from orbit, the gameplay never stops being exhilarating.
The combat offers a seamless blend of infantry and mech-based gameplay. Titans, the giant mechanized war machines, add a layer of strategy to the combat. Each Titan comes with unique abilities and playstyles, ensuring there’s something for everyone. Pilots and Titans complement each other perfectly, making every battle feel dynamic and intense.

Multiplayer: A Double-Edged Sword[/h1]
Titanfall 2’s multiplayer was revolutionary at launch, providing chaotic and action-packed matches where players could seamlessly switch between Pilots and Titans. Modes like Attrition and Last Titan Standing kept players hooked with a mix of tactical and frenetic gameplay. The progression system, customization options, and map designs were all top-notch.
Unfortunately, time has not been kind to Titanfall 2’s multiplayer. With the rise of Apex Legends, Respawn Entertainment’s wildly popular battle royale game, Titanfall 2's servers have become much less active. It’s a sad reality that this incredible multiplayer experience has been largely abandoned by the player base, leaving many matches sparsely populated or difficult to find. For a game that thrives on competitive energy, this lack of activity is a noticeable drawback.

[h1]Graphics and Sound Design: A Feast for the Senses[/h1]
Visually, Titanfall 2 still holds up beautifully, even years after its release. The environments are diverse and detailed, ranging from lush forests to industrial war zones. The Titans themselves are intricately designed, showcasing their power and scale.
The sound design is equally impressive. The heavy footsteps of a Titan, the crackling of energy weapons, and the atmospheric music all combine to immerse players in the game’s sci-fi universe. It’s a sensory experience that feels both grand and intimate.

[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
Titanfall 2 is a masterclass in first-person shooter design. Its innovative gameplay, heartfelt campaign, and exhilarating multiplayer make it one of the finest FPS games of its generation. However, the decline in multiplayer activity and the rise of Apex Legends have left this incredible game underappreciated by newer audiences.
If you haven’t experienced Titanfall 2 yet, it’s a must-play for the campaign alone. It’s a love letter to innovation in gaming, and for those lucky enough to find a multiplayer match, it’s a reminder of what peak FPS multiplayer can look like. Whether you’re new to the series or a returning fan, Titanfall 2 deserves your attention, it’s a game that truly deserves to stand tall, even if its servers are quiet. | Worth it for the campaign alone, but you get a sick co-op mode on top!

*ler mensagem:* contemple... o anel pristino! | 엘든 링이라는 게임 말이죠. 제가 이 게임을 하면서 느낀 건, 이건 그냥 게임이 아니라 제 삶 그 자체라는 겁니다. 야구하면서 힘들었던 시절이 떠오르더라고요. 트리가드라는 첫 보스를 보자마자, 이거야말로 저를 시험하는 신의 장난 같았어요. 처음에는 딱 보자마자 “아, 이 정도는 껌이지”라고 생각했죠. 그런데 아니더라고요. 던지자마자 맞고, 굴렀는데도 맞고, 그러다 결국 다섯 시간을 죽도록 싸우고 나서야 겨우 이겼습니다. 그때 느낀 감정이 뭐였냐면요. “아, 이건 그냥 내 영혼이 싸운 거다.”

야구로 따지면 2회에 갑작스럽게 마운드에 올라가서 볼넷 던지고 나서, 코치님이 올라와서 “긴장하지 마라, 편하게 던져라”라고 했던 순간이 떠올랐어요. 그때처럼, 이 게임도 포기하지 않고 계속 던지다 보니 공이 포수 글러브에 쏙쏙 들어가듯, 보스의 패턴이 보이기 시작하더라고요. 결국 직구처럼 강하게 한 방 날리고, 트리가드를 쓰러뜨렸습니다. 이게 뭐랄까요, 그 짜릿함은 그냥 표현할 방법이 없습니다.

그리고 이 게임의 오픈월드는 말이죠, 제가 처음 미국으로 가서 야구장에서 길을 잃었던 그때를 떠올리게 했습니다. 길을 걷다 보면 갑자기 동굴이 나타나고, 그 안에는 무시무시한 보스가 기다리고 있어요. 그런데 그걸 깨고 나면 이상한 아이템이 나오고, 그게 또 나중에 엄청난 역할을 하더라고요. 야구로 따지면, 마이너리그에서 그 힘들었던 날들이 나중에 메이저리그에서 자신감을 주는 것과 같았어요. 그 과정 하나하나가 소중한 추억이 되고, 나를 단단하게 만들어주는 거죠.

스토리도 참 난해하더라고요. NPC들이 무슨 말을 하는데, 딱 제 영어 초창기 시절 생각났어요. 감독님한테 “Hey, how are you?” 한 마디 하려고도 얼마나 연습했는지 몰라요. 근데 그 어색한 대화 속에서, 오히려 진짜 나를 찾게 되는 느낌이 있었습니다. 이 게임도 마찬가지예요. 이 세상이 왜 이렇게 망가졌는지, 내가 왜 싸워야 하는지 고민하다 보면, “아, 이건 그냥 내 이야기구나” 싶더라고요.

결론적으로 엘든 링은 그냥 게임이 아닙니다. 이건 우리 삶 그 자체입니다. 어려운 상황에서 넘어지고 다시 일어서고, 그러면서 성장하는 그 과정이야말로 우리가 왜 도전하고, 왜 살아가는지를 보여주는 것 같아요. 제가 은퇴 후에도 팬들 덕분에 새로운 길을 걸을 수 있었던 것처럼, 이 게임도 플레이어에게 새로운 길을 열어주는 힘을 가진 것 같아요. | FYI- I finished the main game then I posted this review there is a lot of side content left

I would recommend it 9/10 | Если ты думаешь, что сегодняшний день тебя как-то подавил или морально размазал, то не беспокойся, Elden Ring даст понять, что сейчас он будет делать с тобой тоже самое, но еще и с задержкой, к которой привыкнуть достаточно сложно. Но всё преодолимо. Спасибо, Бабадзаки, что добавил прыжки и рогатую клячу. Единственный босс, которого так и не удалось одолеть - гравитация. 
Лучшая игра для того, чтобы отдохнуть, повеселиться и расслабиться. | Oh boy, where do I even start with Elden Ring? Imagine a game where the devs were like, "Let's make every blade of grass deadly." You step into this gorgeous world, thinking, "This looks like a chill spot for a picnic," only to realize the picnic's actually your wake.

The graphics? Chef's kiss. It's like you're inside a Van Gogh painting, but every stroke wants to off you. The landscapes are so stunning, you'll forget to breathe – until you fall off a cliff.

Combat in Elden Ring isn't about skill; it's about how many times you can bash your head against a wall before you get it right. Every boss fight feels like they've got a personal beef with you. They're just there to mock your sad attempts at living. (git gud)

The lore? Man, it's deep. So deep you'd need a submarine to get to the bottom of it. And just when you think you've got it, some NPC comes along with a backstory that could be its own book. Good luck figuring out the story; it's like doing a puzzle blindfolded.

But here's the thing: despite all the pain, the frustration, the "I'm uninstalling this" moments, you can't help but love it. There's something about Elden Ring that pulls you back, like a moth to a flame, or a player to their doom.

Final Verdict: 10/10 - Would die over and over again. Elden Ring isn't just a game; it's a way of life. A life of pain, beauty, and the occasional scream into the abyss. If you want something that'll test your patience, your skill, and your swear-word collection, this is it.

[h1]Красивый мир, который я никак не могу вспомнить.[/h1]
Один из самых интереснейших рогаликов, в которые я играл. Здесь прекрасно всё: сюжет, механики, визуальная составляющая и саундтрек, но обо всём по порядку.

[h3]Сюжет[/h3]
Сюжет — по моему мнению, первый козырь игры, который цепляет сходу.
Прежний мир уже не вернуть, но мы помним — помним его части и по пути вспоминаем остальные локации и существ, в том числе и тех, кого мы не очень хотели видеть на дороге. Это завораживает и заставляет играть дальше, узнать мотивацию антагонистов и прочувствовать ощущения главного героя, его скорбь и груз его ответственности. Герой сам не помнит кто он такой, из-за чего и вытекает возможность смены класса. Мы не знаем его увлечений, но чувствуем в его словах... Надежду? Воодушевление? Не знаю.
Я прочёл все описания предметов, карточек и врагов, и могу сказать то, что тут всё продумано. Советую почитать на досуге, ведь это углубляет в мир игры. А ещё там написано всё от лица главного героя, что добавляет интереса к чтению.
[b]10/10[/b]

[h3]Механики[/h3]
Вам никто ничего не объясняет, вы всё должны пробовать на свой страх и риск. Нигде не напишут что за 10 гор/холмов вы резко вспомните ещё и о существовании гоблинов, или же о том, что вампиры не против полакомиться жителями деревни. Это увлекает и забавляет, а также в этот момент вы строите в голове сотни комбинаций с другими картами, которые вы можете применить в своем забеге.
Но комбинаций не очень много, и вы быстро их запомните, а также (по моему мнению) не хватает счётчика ландшафтных карт.
[b]9/10[/b]

[h3]Графика[/h3]
Я люблю пиксель-арты, и здесь всё идеально. Нет ярких цветов, что подобает мрачному сюжету. Очень понравились арты снаряжения и, особенно, боссов, что делает их незабываемыми врагами и примером отличного и продуманного врага. За всю игру мы увидим 2 кат-сцены и они шедевральны. Я даже поделился ими с друзьями, настолько мне они понравились, настолько в них влили душу.
[b]10/10[/b]

[h3]Саундтрек[/h3]
Очень понравился саундтрек в лагере, в первой кат-сцене и в титрах [spoiler]и в босс-файте с Омегой[/spoiler]. Когда его слушаешь, в голове так и возникают образы смерти и неизбежного конца, что очень сильно погружает в атмосферу и без того мрачного сюжета. blinch (автор сего аудио-творения) постарался на славу.
В остальных случаях — музыка просто подходит под стиль игры: не особо затянута, без сильных битов, не запоминается, и ощущается заЦИКЛенной (ba-dum-tss).
[b]9/10[/b]

[h3]Итог[/h3]
Мне очень понравился данный рогалик. После The Binding of Isaac и Enter the Gungeon почувствовал что-то новое и необычное. Советую поиграть в данный шедевр тем, кто либо знаком с рогаликами и ищет точку интереса, либо тем, кто обожает пиксели и читать.
У меня всё. Благодарю Four Quarters за данный инди-шедевр, а вас за прочтение данного обзора.
[h2]10/10[/h2] | 玩的差不多了后觉得这游戏挺可惜的，创意确实很亮眼，当年还被TGA提名过，但是呢制作组并没有深耕的打算导致游戏就像个半成品一样。
1：作为主打肉鸽的游戏可重复游玩性却不如人意，到后期基本上就是无聊的刷，这一点可以说是致命的
2：游戏的自由度太高，而在前期惩罚也太高导致初上手的挫败感很强，新手引导特别不过关
3：到后期输了没感觉，赢了也没感觉，唯一感受到的就是时间流逝
总结的说，制作组愿意深耕的话以上问题都有解决的办法，凭借这个创意说不定可以做出一款里程碑式的作品，可惜他们并不在意，不过话说回来打折后的价格性价比没得说，值得喜欢独立游戏的各位买一个体验一下
 | La verdad es que este juego lo llevo jugando desde que salio, sin embargo lo jugaba pirateado en vieja pc, en cuanto mejore con respecto a pc lo primero que compre fue este juego y no eh parado de jugarlo. | I'd give it a 7/10

I had a lot of fun playing this game on my steamdeck while traveling but I will 100% say this game feels kind of unfinished and poorly balanced. A lot of my enjoyment was derived from trying to figure out how to win on the harder difficulties with each character in spite of the poor balancing. 

It's definitely a neat concept that I havent seen done before and I enjoyed discovering neat combinations of tiles on the map like Village + Vampire Manor = Vampire Town. But I wish there was more of that. There should be dozens and dozens of combinations and interactions, but there's really not. It feels like there's content waiting to be implemented but it just never came. 

It's got some soft "gambling" elements in that you can end runs early to cash in your treasure or you can always go for another loop or attempt a boss in an all-or-nothing kind of way. It's fun but frustrating in a not so great way. | Fantastic game and gorgeous visuals, normally not a fan of grindy games, but this feels like you make genuine progress every time you play

Tho one thing linux users should know, make sure compatibility layer uses the latest version of proton!

Absolutely one of the best autistic revisionist history time sinks to ever exist. One massive suggestion would include the renaming of cities captured by one culture in said culture's name for said city. I think this would allow for more comprehension and understanding of how cultures view one another and the possible claim fabrication could become that much more justified. | I genuinely love this game, i have 200 hours now and I imagine that number will continue to increase, it's a detailed and immersive game that provides an excellent sandbox for a multitude of play-styles from painting the map one colour to role-playing as any character you wish. Its great.

There's a but though, they have increased dlc prices and consistently shown disregard and disrespect to the money of the players. We don't care if there's one dlc a year or a million, we want quality at an affordable price, especially not to the point where without sales it will cost over one hundred pounds just to add flavour and nuance to the game. 

Focus on delivering high quality, affordable games where you listen and communicate with the community and then the money will follow.

 | Я полностью повторил историю древней Руси причем чисто случайно, каждый правитель был максимально историчен: у каждого было столько же детей сколько было в реальности, каждый правил примерно столько же сколько в реальности, даже события по типу регентства Ольги повторились. Я делал это все не намеренно. Чтобы отомстить игре за такую историчность было принято решение принять ислам. Кто же знал, что за это дадут ачивку... | Прикольный симс для мужиков, с возможностью убийства детей и соблазнением близких родственников. | O jogo é extremamente complexo, porém é divertido. Eu diria que a sua melhor definição seria: "The Sims para homens". Nele, você tem liberdade para jogar como quiser e criar seus próprios objetivos na rica história da idade média.  
A avaliação negativa é pelo óbvio: *o jogo não tem tradução para o português*. Isso acaba deixando tudo extremamente cansativo porque há muita, mas muita coisa para ler. Considerando também que possui um linguajar medieval, isso acaba complicando ainda mais. Jogar na própria língua nativa melhoraria a jogabilidade em 2000%.
Dito isso, em questão de gameplay acho que daria pra melhorar o sistema de Causus Belli. Ao meu ver, a conquista através das batalhas se dá de uma maneira extremamente lenta. Sei que a proposta do jogo é ser mais cadenciado em certo sentido, mas às vezes a lentidão do progresso não parece compatível com o pace de outras mecânicas do jogo. 
Conclusão: é um jogo bem interessante e que te prende muito, jogue disponibilizando pra si mesmo bastante tempo. Se estiver na promoção, compre às expansões, infelizmente esses jogos de estratégia continuam com políticas de preço abusivas e irrealistas. Por fim, repito, é uma vergonha um jogo desse nível, de uma empresa estabelecida no mercado, não ter uma tradução para o Português.

Easily my favourite Total War. In my opinion, the best battle game play by far. It just feels smooth where it needs to be, sharp and responsive and I appreciate the aesthetic design throughout, not just because of the Japanese theme, but the overall tone of the artwork. Also arrows are effective which is nice to see in a TW game. 10/10 and then some with workshop mods. | Total War: Shogun 2 - это суровый мир самураев, династий и стратегических сражений, который сразу же захватил мое внимание. Эта игра не просто стратегия, это целая эпоха, в которой каждый выбор может изменить ход истории. 

Плюсы:
1. Сюжет игры, основанный на исторических событиях, позволяет взять на себя роль одного из кланов и вести его к власти. Это не просто борьба за территорию, но и глубокая стратегическая игра, где нужно учитывать политические интриги, дипломатические отношения и экономическое развитие. Каждый выбор имеет значение, и это придает игре особую глубину.
2. Атмосфера Японии периода Сэнгоку передана с невероятной детализацией для игры 2011 года: от красивых пейзажей до неплохо проработанных юнитов, каждый элемент создает ощущение погружения в игру.
3. Музыкальное оформление заслуживает отдельного лайка! Звуки природы, традиционная японская музыка и эпические мелодии во время сражений создают уникальную атмосферу, которая усиливает погружение в игру.
4. Огромный плюс игры в том, что какую-никакую кампанию можно проходить с другом! Это очень круто, весело и дает больше разнообразия для совместных стратегических действий.

Минусы:
1. Иногда искусственный интеллект может показаться не совсем адекватным, а некоторые элементы управления слишком топорные и требуют времени на привыкание. 
2. В некоторых моментах игра может показаться медленной, особенно в начале, когда нужно развивать экономику и строить армию (на что уходит куча времени).

Total War: Shogun 2 - это великолепное сочетание стратегии и истории, которое оставляет после себя теплые эмоции и желание вернуться в этот удивительный мир. Если вы любите стратегические игры, серию Тотал Вар и просто хотите на чилле/на расслабоне погонять самураев по карте, то, игра вам определенно понравится. | Fuck you corpos for destroying a great game! Can't run mods, and without em still crashes, thx assholes | 全战里最喜欢的一代，即使是十年前的游戏在今天看来依旧雄风犹在，使用reshade后画质甚至已达到了电影级，再者幕府2作为开山之作幕府1的续作，发售之后再次成为全战不得不品的经典之作，全战系列除了几个外传没买都已经有了，战锤3可能对于战锤这个ip来说是史诗级游戏，但作为一款全战来说，我个人而言对此并不满意，单从战斗方面来说，幕府2的精密细节水准无出其右，也是第一部着重于pvp对战平衡来制作的全面战争，在当时具有跨时代的意义，在幕府2之后发售的罗马2则开始沦为血条全战，以及之后的所有作品，全都不再是1对1的战斗，而是血条制度，战斗细节逐渐敷衍，空气刀逐渐盛行，玩起来已然失去了全战该有的精髓，食之无味弃之可惜，这些就像在玩传奇一样无趣，就连战前演讲的设计也被废除了，只有特定的事件战役才有战前演讲，不知是说他越做越大了还是越来越商业了，除了堆量卖dlc就是敷衍中的敷衍，ca的新作法老就是一个最好的例子，也别提因为想要为法老引流宣传对老作品进行强制更新的操作，玩家曾尝试退版本来抗议，但ca一意孤行不为所动，并禁用了退版本的功能，此举导致了幕府2的mod社区遭受重创。地图模组全部失效，武家之殇的mod也出现一些闪退无声音的问题，pvp的聊天功能被删除，除此之外未对游戏推出任何的实质性更新内容，社区管理也只是一味的捂嘴不让说，禁止提出建议，仿佛在ca眼里，他们忠实的老玩家已失去了利用价值，只有迎合战锤的新玩家才是ca目前的摇钱树和救命稻草，三国的停更导致只到汉末，三国也是名存实亡，ca时至今日可惜还是未曾吸取教训，仍然拒绝沟通，一意孤行已成为常态，就看ca他这种态度还能走多远，小心，法老的失败已经使得世嘉逐渐失去耐心，也是不得不重新评估你ca的实际可存价值，下一作如果还是法老这种质量，那离解散重组已不再遥远

上手之后会立马显得重复度略高，而且局外成长太花时间，要体验到完整的内容很费劲。

其次在上强度之后，游戏会从模拟建设瞬间转化成微操资源管理，人力和资源的极致运用才能让你拿下胜利，你说肉鸽？什么肉鸽？哪有肉鸽？建设？哪有建设？

这不算充足的随机性除了能让你升血压并不能让你的体验得到提升，毕竟这个游戏所有的肉鸽收益基本都是有滞后性的，鲜少有立即生效却对你收益巨大的情况出现，游戏本身也是比起解决问题更倾向于让问题防患于未然，可以说基本都处于一种今日受苦而明日享福的循环，而人往往并不待见延迟满足，这也是城市建造类游戏的通病，随机性则让这一点被增幅了许多，毕竟脸黑一下的话你的精心布局很可能要到游戏尾声才得以找到key牌启动。

在真正上手游戏的中后期，本作特色的“肉鸽”“建设”属性可以说是基本等于没有（甚至肉鸽方面可能是负作用？），冲着这两点来的颇有几分受骗的味道。高强度下的资源匮乏和时间赛跑让游戏的建设属性约等于无，时间全花在拼尽全力管理有效利用资源上，而肉鸽属性正反馈不足，且低难度通解太多、高难度拿不到最优解血压又太高，负反馈很强导致肉鸽的设计很抽象。

相对的，游戏耐玩、结构与内容完整，微创新也不少，上手简单易懂，游戏内有明确的阶段性目标，能让城建玩的少的玩家不至于迷失方向不知道该做什么，每一局的目标不一样一定程度上保持了新鲜感都是值得肯定的优点。

总的来说是值得一个好评的，入手推荐史低，另DLC风评远不如本体，慎入。 | Against the Storm focuses on the best part of a city builder which is the first hours when you are in the building phase.  Against the Storm plays out differently every time because the buildings you start with are always different.   It is a well optimized game, with constant choices of risk vs reward, and enjoyable when you figure out work-arounds for meeting necessary resources, through supply chain management.

What I appreciate about Against the Storm is that there is never is a point where it gets too complicated with too much too deal with at one time.  The equivalent of the "Boss battle" is challenging and rewarding.  Graphic and sound design are excellent.

I've played over 650 hours and still not sick of it, so there must be something to this video game.  

Support these devs.  Eremite Games is a Polish developer consisting of six, and they really have created a real gem of a game, and they have been actively improving and polishing the game for more than a year after the day 1 release. | I genuinely started off liking Against the Storm, but the further you get into the difficulties the more tedious it gets, with additional negative modifiers and additional hoops to jump through to complete the session. Each seal completion really incentivizes you to play the next difficulty to get enough shards to complete the next seal to follow the metaplot, and lower difficulties may not get you the number of seals you need in time - additionally, the further out you go, the higher the minimum difficulty of the embarkment is, pushing the player to embark on those higher difficulty options. Why progress the seals other than metaplot? So you get more resources for the Citadel metaprogression. Which does things like add resources to your starting caravan so you can actually build some production buildings at the start, or adding a production building that let you make many key items - poorly, at high cost, but beneficial for the build chains so you are not fully reliant on RNG to get a building to complete the chain, or even adding bonuses to each race in your settlement like showing you where the first set of fields is where you can build a farm the first time you recruit a Human, so you don't have to spend half the session opening the wrong glades and never getting the constant food production that would provide. 

Except like many modern roguelite hybrids, this metaprogression is poorly balanced, and time consuming, which makes it feel like busywork rather than enjoyable on its own. It makes the higher difficulties less tedious to tackle (especially with some of the more helpful bonuses), but it just feels like an absolute chore to get through. Speaking of chores, they just add more chores without opening meaningful doors and mechanics past Veteran in terms of the difficulty options. The first three difficulties add mechanics each jump - after Veteran comes Viceroy, which is the same thing as Veteran with new forbidden and dangerous glade events to threaten your settlement and that the forest is more hostile by a multiplier of x3 instead of x2, but they don't do anything "new" really, they are just more of what you have seen before on earlier difficulties, and they just cost a ton of resources that you may not have been able to produce unless you have enough bonuses from the metaprogression tree and otherwise they apply so many negative benefits your game may actually end, such as the Stormbird which as far as I can tell by searching across the internet, people have been complaining is poorly balanced even with a good settlement for years. I don't just mean negatively either - the Stormbird applies an infinite storm effect, locking you to a year until you finish it (which you could delay), which is abusable in its own right if you were lucky enough to find it early. The Stormbird is just absurdly out of band in both directions and I cannot understand the intent of including it compared to every other event. I suppose that its very existence changes the logic pattern of whether you should open forbidden glades at all, but the higher difficulties disincentivize the opening of small glades due to hostility modifiers, so that just leaves dangerous glades if you do not want to starve but want to ensure a manageable event. What a forcible winnowing of the meta - it creates a very rote playstyle even though the apparent point of RNG building choice to create more unstable, dynamic push-and-pull gameplay. 

By the way, the tree also has a level attached - as you go through various sessions you get XP, when you level up you unlock new buildings and cornerstones (buffs) to show up in the game. THIS metaprogression mechanic is where the actual doors are opened for new build orders. Except its just as slow as the tree since its a blocker on the tree - without those later buildings and cornerstones, the game is not necessarily giving you the tools to win on higher difficulties. The amount of XP seems really low as well no matter the difficulty and even with completing various achievement challenges, which just exacerbates the issue.

I assume the decision not to bind those buildings and cornerstones to the higher difficulties and instead to a metaprogression level was so that you can use them on the lower difficulties and practice various build chains, but without overwhelming people when they start to play, and because of the complexity of creating a system that could both leave them default on the higher difficulties and then unlock them for use on the lower one once you cleared the higher one. Though perhaps they could have used their training missions for this. In all honesty the buildings beyond the first few levels matter less than the cornerstones, but they both add to how obnoxious the metaprogression system is - even if it is justified ludonarratively. 

In positives, I genuinely like the give and take between blight and production starting with the Veteran difficulty. I enjoy the season model and how each session naturally pushes you to modify your build chain on the fly or attempt to produce enough of your current resources to trade for the things you need to complete the Orders. I enjoy the fact that a session can take no more than one hour or maybe two at the higher speeds and therefore allows a bite-sized city building experience. I genuinely did get 30 hours out of it so I would say I got my money's worth, and I may play some more now and again, but anything that sufficiently annoys me more than it captivates me gets a negative review especially when the causes will not be immediately apparent to the player. | Let me preface this by saying that the game is very well made and I understand why so many people love it. I am not refunding it for any notable flaws.

For me specifically, when I play this type of game I want to dig in and work on one continuous settlement and make it grow over time, eventually getting to a point where I have this massive city that basically runs itself, giving me a primal sense of satisfaction that doesn't need to be felt again for roughly two years. But this game is a rogue-lite with some aspects of a mobile game, where you constantly restart a 'run', so to speak, unlocking stuff to make things more interesting for the next one. And though well-crafted, it's just not the kind of thing I'm looking for in a city-builder. | 与其说是城市营造或者基地建设，更像是有限资源管理游戏，不符合我的兴趣

Genres: Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
Reviews: I've played Runescape way back since 2005, before Runescape 2 and 3. There's always a part of me that yearns to play this game, no matter how old I get. The grind has become immense compared to when I first played, and the micro transactions have kept me from playing any more. Sure, there's an ironman mode you can play to avoid that for the most part, but micro transactions have still become a fundamental feature of the game itself which takes away from the grind many of us suffered in the early days, before you could basically buy experience or items from Jagex themselves. | amazing game, brings my childhood memories, a little bit the new combat is off but it is still good | fishng

Not a bad game per session, and I was actually having a lot of fun. Until I went to multiplayer.

The movement there is just broken to the point of being unplayable.
Everyone makes the orders on their turn, then the movement and attacks happen in a seemingly random order.
This means that if you're the last in turn order you can get your big unit move blocked by a scout. 
You'll get shot first before getting to do anything. 
You'll get flanked because you've not moved yet, so the enemy has perfect knowledge.
You'll have your disembarks move blocked - the charge card you paid for? Wasted. Pick a different cell next turn? Then can just move to it.

It's not just bad, it's infuriatingly unfair if you're not player 1. | Unlike some other games, you do not need to spend a whole days working at a map; sometimes a half hour is enough, leaving you time to play another round or just to avoid the necessity of trying to cram two hours of sleep before the morning alarm clock. There are many modes to try; I particularly like the Hegemony battles - not because I always win but because I sometimes don't although I wish there were a forum for each of the various civilisations (factions) so that I could see if there are other players that consistently favour one or some civs over others rather than just wondering if folks are merely jumping onto the bandwagon of the one leading faction.. The developers are good at staying on top of the little issues. | Very nice game, but unfortunately very badly balanced... to bad!

Will give it a thumps up anyways, because besides the balance its pretty neat. | Low online in MP but otherwise a great game. I just wish it got updated more often | the more I play it, the more I like it. gives a pretty great 4x experience in a reasonable time session.

It's a great piece of cyberpunk, with a rich, gritty setting and a writing style that's that perfect mix of lyrically poignant and flatly cynical. It can get repetitive as you level up skills and manage the other minutiae of life, but the stories are captivating. Single quests have left me feeling more than some entire AAA games. 

Personally I like the limited action mechanic because it means I'm in for the long haul, I'm not going to burn through all the content in a matter of days and be left wanting more. 51 hours and I've hardly scratched the surface. It's amazing to me that this is all free. 

Definitely worth a try if you enjoy the cyberpunk genre! | The game is a text driven game and a great create your own story narrative.  However the game is  repetitive and a lot of the side missions are just uncompletable.  It hardly gives clues as to what your supposed to do and how you go about it.  The errand running missions are the most frustrating.  because you can't finish them.  This has potential to be a great game however it just needs more time.  I would have cooked this for a bit longer. | "The notion that nature can be calculated inevitably leads to the conclusion that humans too can be reduced to basic mechanical parts..."

So, welcome back. If you're here you probably know about this game, if not, here's my attempt at being brief. cyberpunkdreams is a really neat and overwhelmingly fresh game that's flourished over the years of development.

I'm going to start this by saying I'm on the writing staff. So, yeah. I've been testing one version or another of this game off and on since 2016 through its alpha, beta, and now gamma. The testing I've done has been a lot longer than my working on things. So, understand. I know the flaws and where they are.

I've been able to get this much time (18623 as of the edit) out of the game: A) Because cyberpunkdreams is meant to be taken in over time, and B) Because there is a massive amount of content to dig through (and the game is continuing to grow). cyberpunkdreams is a text based game, so the quality of the gameplay is in its writing, the quantity of said writing, and the choices you can make throughout it. Be prepared to make choices. Lots of choices: about who you are, why you're here, and how you interact with the world. Who are you?

So, why are you here and what are you doing here? Well that's up to you, but most of us are here for a job. Whether that be an investigation or one last run in the core. You are for the most part a blank slate free to define yourself, having had your past scrubbed out of you to avoid being tracked and caught. There are always indications of who you once were, but that's a question for later. You're here to do a job and the path to doing that job is where the bulk of the content lies.

So, what do you do in Cinci? For awhile you'll be scrounging around, learning the city, and engaging in various schemes to establish yourself. Given time though you'll start to engage in more and more lucrative trades and businesses, get your hands on higher quality equipment, and find better sources of income to successfully establish yourself. Challenge gangs, bring war to the streets.

As the game is named, this is a cyberpunk game, and as the creator puts it: back to basics. cyberpunkdreams is a game about criminal activity, the punk aspect and how it relates to the cyber. The suffering and heights that come from that, living with the consequences of how you act and relating to your circumstance. You probably won't have much of that cyber stuff for awhile, but if you persist you can start getting your hands on the tech needed to start having an impact.

It's up to you how you establish yourself, and the choices you make along the way define who your character is as a person. There are easy ways to make quick cash, and there are hard ways to make alot. How do you treat other people and interact with them? Are you a nice guy, the bastard who goes around breaking limbs, or somewhere inbetween? Most of us are somewhere inbetween. Go straight vigilante some day. It's fun. He who makes a beast of himself gets rid of the pain of being a man.

Explore the world, learn about it, find stories within it. Meet its characters, build your resources, and develop an organisation of your own. Prepare for your mission, eventually you'll need to pick up the pieces and act on it. You need to make the right choices, and be ready at just the right time to make your impact.

And remember, there are characters. An important part of this game is the characters, their stories and how they react to your choices and behaviours. Build a crew but word to the wise, don't look to make all of them part of your crew, it will drive you crazy trying to cater to all of them in the long term.

Gameplay wise, well that's tough. This is a text based game built around choices, there are games resembling this but not of this level of complexity. Pick a storylet or branch, a card. Make a choice, see the impact and move forward. Fairly simple on the surface, but it's about building routines and growing as a character as you experience the writing.

World wise it's a well thought out depiction of the mid future, we're somewhere around the 2090s, and things feel like it. A combination of climate change, societal collapse, and wars have broken America. Without going into the state of the rest of the world. Corporations drove privatisation and have strode through what was once the territory of the government. Taking over where the local government has faltered. Corruption is rampant, and everything is for sale. Technology has advanced, the panopticon is nearing a reality, and hope is dim unless we start a fire.

So, about that cyber stuff. Technology is constantly moving forward, and the commodification of human advancement is a reality. Even basic knowledge and memory is mutable and implants are speeding this up with the development of spikes. This is particularly the subject of my content.

So, Implants Implants Implants. There are some and we've been promised more. The ability to upgrade the human body and the symbiotes you take in. More radical body mods and prosthesis. The ones that are there are worthwhile in my mind, though you'll need to be pretty established to start picking them up. Being bulletproof is always a worthwhile goal.

We're not at terminator levels yet, but that will happen for us if we want it and work for it. See you at the Harmont clinic.

I don't have much more to say. How would I rate this game? Not perfect, but nothing is and the beauty in something is not in its perfection it's in the imperfections. The ones you can appreciate anyway. I certainly recommend this game, though I will admit bias at this point. I've been here awhile. | Lovely little game, well written in general, and plenty of choices. I've really been enjoying my time with the game, and am looking forward to more over the years.

"Few Nights More" invites players to step into the role of a vampire lord, reclaiming their rightful place in a dark, atmospheric world. Defend your castle, harness your vampiric powers, and outsmart rival forces in your quest for dominance. The game’s engaging narrative draws you into a tale of revenge and conquest, where each decision shapes your path. Will your vampire lord triumph and reclaim their throne, or will they succumb to the relentless forces of humanity?[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]

[h1]Detailed review:[/h1]

[table]
[tr]
[td][b]Key Features:[/b][/td]
[td]
🩸 [b]Castle Management Gameplay:[/b] Build, upgrade, and defend your castle by adding traps, minions, and new rooms. Earn bonuses from luxurious decorations while preparing for nightly invasions until dawn.

🧛 [b]Vampiric Progression System:[/b] Select one of eight vampire lords, each with their own story, playstyle, and abilities. Master one of three disciplines during each run, with 60 unique skills to unlock.

♻️ [b]Procedural Challenges:[/b] Overcome three acts across 12 difficulty levels. Encounter unique hunters, veterans, and bosses in dynamic, turn-based battles.

🎨 [b]Dark Gothic Atmosphere:[/b] Immerse yourself in a grim, atmospheric world enhanced by thematic visuals and a haunting soundtrack.

⚔️ [b]Tactical Turn-Based Combat:[/b] Test your strategies in battles where positioning, skill selection, and resource management are key.
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🌟[b]Overview:[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
"Few Nights More" is a unique blend of roguelike strategy and turn-based combat, set in a Gothic world where players take on the role of a vampire lord reclaiming their domain. Through castle management and tactical battles, the game offers an engaging experience for fans of dark fantasy and challenging gameplay.
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🎮[b]Gameplay:[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
🏰 [b]Castle Building and Defense:[/b] Customize and fortify your castle with traps, rooms, and minions to repel nightly invaders.

🛡️ [b]Turn-Based Combat:[/b] Engage in deep tactical battles that demand precision and strategic planning.

🔄 [b]Roguelike Mechanics:[/b] Progress through runs to unlock new skills, upgrades, and equipment for your vampire lord.

⚒️ [b]Customization and Strategy:[/b] Tailor your playstyle by choosing from eight unique vampire lords, each offering distinct abilities and progression options.

🎲 [b]Endless Mode:[/b] Test your limits in an infinite challenge mode where you must make strategic choices nightly to strengthen your character and push further.
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]📖[b]Story and Depth:[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
While the narrative focuses more on gameplay than story, the lore of vampiric revenge and dominance is compelling. The dark, Gothic atmosphere enhances the immersive experience, though the game primarily shines in its mechanics and replayability.
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🏆[b]Verdict:[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]
"Few Nights More" is a hidden gem that has been a really enjoyable experience so far, even though I’ve only played for a few hours. What I liked the most is how much thought you need to put into designing your castle. Placing traps and assigning monsters to specific rooms adds a lot of strategy to the game. The monsters you unlock aren’t always the strongest, but they’re great for slowing down and weakening the enemies as they move through your castle. If you position and upgrade them properly, they can clear out weaker enemies, making the fight easier when the tougher ones arrive.

That said, the strongest enemies always find a way to push through to your chamber. They attack in groups and can be pretty overwhelming, especially since recovering HP as a Vampire Lord isn’t easy. You can regain some blood during combat, but the amount is limited, and healing between nights is minimal. This creates a constant tension—if you aren’t well-prepared or take too much damage in earlier fights, the next wave could be your last. Managing your skills and resources carefully is crucial to handle these high-pressure moments, and the game does a great job of keeping you on edge.

Even after just a few hours, I can tell this is a game I’ll want to come back to regularly. The satisfaction of seeing your defenses come together, experimenting with strategies, and watching your Vampire Lord grow stronger makes every run feel rewarding. It’s clear how much care went into crafting this game, from the strategic depth to the immersive Gothic atmosphere. "Few Nights More" is a solid choice for fans of strategy and roguelike games, and I’m looking forward to playing more and refining my approach in future runs.
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]✅[b]Good:[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]👍 [b]Strategic depth in castle management:[/b] Placing traps and assigning monsters to rooms adds a satisfying layer of planning and strategy.

👍 [b]High replay value:[/b] Procedurally generated encounters, unlockable vampire lords, and various skill combinations make each run unique.

👍 [b]Dark Gothic atmosphere:[/b] Detailed character and castle designs, combined with immersive music, create a captivating setting.

👍 [b]Challenging but fair gameplay:[/b] The difficulty scales well, rewarding players who adapt their strategies.

👍 [b]Robust progression system:[/b] Unlockable skills, abilities, and upgrades for vampire lords offer variety and encourage experimentation.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
[tr]
[th]🛠️[b]Ways of Improvement:[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]👎 [b]Limited monster effectiveness:[/b] Monsters often feel underpowered against stronger enemies, even when upgraded.

👎 [b]Repetitive wave structure:[/b] While engaging, the enemy waves and gameplay loop could use more variation to maintain long-term freshness.

👎 [b]Slow healing mechanics:[/b] HP recovery during and between nights is minimal, which can make consecutive fights punishing for less-prepared players.

👎 [b]Steep learning curve:[/b] The game can be unforgiving for new players without a tutorial or guidance on strategy.[/td]
[/tr]

Lots of effects have "every X" nights but it isn't clear when they trigger.

On skill selection there's lots of "effects" that aren't explained. What does "enfold" do for example?

For extended endgame you need to merge an orb but if it's not equipped in slot 1,2 or 3 it's not detected so you get a game over.

Few Nights More est roguelite de  défense de base au tour par tour qui ressemble beaucoup à un jeu de plateau aussi bien dans sa présentation que dans ses mécaniques de jeu.

On y incarne dans un monde médiéval fantastique le chef d’un clan de vampires qui tente de faire un comeback en même temps que le reste de son espèce. Evidemment les soi-disant forces du bien ne l’entendent pas de cette oreille et tentent donc de vous déloger de l’un de vos anciens châteaux vous servant de base d’opérations.  C’est donc un scénario simple et sans carabistouilles, ce qui n’empêche le jeu de nous servir quelques miettes de lore dans des descriptions d’objets ou de personnages.

Le but du jeu est de tenir 18 nuits et comme vous vous en doutez c’est bien plus facile à dire qu’à faire. Autant commencer par choisir son clan ; après tout il y en a huit en tout et chacun possède des forces, des faiblesses et un style de jeu très différent des autres : entre celui qui mange ses ennemis, celui qui se téléporte pour lancer des trous noirs à bout portant ou encore celui qui est une armure vivante incapable de se soigner, vous en trouverez forcément un à votre gout.
Il vous faut ensuite choisir une école de magie vampire parmi quatre. Chacune a évidemment des mécaniques de jeu différentes et vous permet de sélectionner vos deux techniques de combat de bas mais également les compétences que vous pourrez éventuellement utiliser pendant votre run. Enfin il vous faudra déterminer dans quel château organiser votre défense, sachant que chacun a évidemment un plan et des particularités propres.

Une fois en jeu une nuit se déroule toujours de la même manière. Tout d’abord vous avez une phase de préparation où vous pouvez placer librement votre personnage ainsi que des pièges et des monstres dans les différentes salles à votre disposition. Le but est d’éviter le décès de votre seigneur ou la destruction de son cercueil et c’est donc à vous d’anticiper la menace que vous souhaitez gérer en priorité en fonction des mouvements annoncés de vos ennemis ; vous vous doutez bien qu’un groupe de mercenaires déterminé à piller votre salle de bal constitue une menace moins pressante que celle d’un paladin décidé à vous administrer l’extrême-onction.

Ensuite vient la phase d’action et de combat où les groupes antagonistes pénètrent sur votre domaine. Les pièges et les monstres leur infligent des dégâts physiques et mentaux en priorité mais le combat s’engage dès que vous vous retrouvez dans la même pièce que vos envahisseurs. S’engage alors un affrontement au tour par tour relativement classique utilisant un système de points d’action mais aussi de recharge de compétences si une condition est remplie. Par exemple mon attaque de base coûtant 1 PA peut simplement retrouver deux de ses cinq utilisations au tour suivant, mais un buff gratuit peut avoir un temps de recharge de cinq tours. Rajoutez des reliques aux pouvoirs actifs et vous aurez de quoi jongler avec de nombreuses possibilités pour mettre au point des combos dévastateurs dont vous aurez bien besoin.

Une fois tous les combats d’une nuit remportés, c’est l’heure du loot ! Il va falloir alors gérer les éventuels gains de caractéristiques bruts, les plans de pièces ayant leurs propres passifs sur trois niveaux d’améliorations, les éléments de décors apportant d’AUTRES passifs, les gains de compétences améliorables, les  événements aléatoires, la répartition de points de réputations qui vous donnent ENCORE D’AUTRES passifs… cela peut paraître beaucoup mais c’est en réalité très digeste et cela contribue bien à nous faire ressentir à quel point notre seigneur de la nuit devient digne de titre. Sans compter que c’est très gratifiant de voir son château prendre des couleurs au fur et à mesure qu’on l’aménage puis qu’on le meuble.

Bref, bis repetita jusqu’à ce que notre mort ou la fin de la 18e nuit survienne.

On ne va pas se mentir : la difficulté monte vite (sans être injuste car la part d’aléatoire est bien moindre que dans un Darkest Dungeon par exemple) et une run complète dure un peu moins de deux heures, ce qui risque de mettre vos nerfs à rude épreuve. Du coup les développeurs ont fait en sorte que les récompenses de fin de partie soient particulièrement copieuses : avec les points gagnés par vos performances vous pouvez améliorer énormément de choses, de votre clan à votre école de vampirisme en passant par le château lui-même. Encore une fois il y a de quoi faire et vous aurez besoin de tout ça si vous voulez vous attaquer aux niveaux de difficulté supérieurs ou au mode infini.

Que dire d’autre sinon que l’enrobage musical et les bruitages sont curieusement quasi-inexistants alors que les environnements sont jolis (dans un style jeu de plateau) et que le chara-design dark fantasy est bien léché. Comme vous l’aurez compris il est néanmoins très copieux et plaisant à jouer, si bien qu’aucune partie de ressemblera vraiment à une autre. Il vaut largement ses presque 15 euros selon moi.

Le Ciel vous tienne en joie. | На данный момент игра максимально сырая, куча багов и недоработок, про русскую локализацию вообще молчу, всё прогнали через гугл переводчик

This is a real hidden gem. The mechanics feel absolutely tight and the gameplay is very engaging. I really enjoy the "bullet-heaven" style mechanic of auto shooting once you get in range. Since most of the weapons are projectile based and not hit-scan, the enemies may be able to dodge the shots, so the platforming becomes very dynamic, dodging the enemies as you try and lock down your shots, as well as stomping on them once you get the chance.

I've encountered plenty of various synergies so far, there seem to be tons of different modifiers, abilities and weapons. Although so far I've found relatively little in terms of player choice in regards to the various power-ups (most of them randomly picked from chests and such), at no point did I feel underpowered or doomed, and it does have the upside of feeling quick and snappy, as usually, given too much choice, I fall into analysis paralysis which slows down the game too much. 
With that said, there are some ways to mitigate the randomness (seller/trader rooms,re-rolls etc).

The runs usually last I'd say between 10-30 minutes, with an option available to save the run and continue another time. The game is quickly becoming my go-to for when I have a few minutes to spare between things. Also Worth noting that it runs beautifully on the Steam Deck.

TL;DR
Absolutely fantastic game, a rare hidden gem which feels absolutely premium. | Squib goes boing boing | NB

First thing, this game is very very addictive, I'd give you that. Once you start a game you will find it very very hard to stop playing. My 227 hours play time should be evidence enough to prove my point. But sadly, among my 227 play time, 99% of it was solo play. I would dearly like to join a clan and play with some other players. But alas, although the game does support clan play, some feature of the game or should I say lack of it, made it very unfriendly for clan play.  

The one thing I hate about this game is that all members within a clan shares everything. And in everything, I mean freaking EVERYTHING. All you can do is to trust in your clan member's ethics and hope they won't rob you blind when you're not in the game. Even the stuff in your so-call personal strongbox can be access by your clan members. So what good is a personal strongbox if everyone can get the stuff you stashed in it. I mean, why put in a personal strongbox in the first place is its utterly useless. At least put in some permission settings for the owner to restrict access to their stuff. 

Another thing is the loot system. I once cleared a tier 2 rift boss when another player came in and took all my loot dropped from the boss. The player was not even a clan member, just another solo player who came in and ninja looted all my stuff. 

All of this BS is making it very hard for anyone to form and invite people into a clan unless all the clan members are also real life friends. No one likes to be betrayed and rob of their hard earn possessions when they are not looking.

But, after mentioning all the bad stuff, I'm still gonna recommend this to others. The solo play is still worth playing. | 76小时全成就，已经被多人残酷模式狠狠地恶心到了。游戏虽然有诸多可圈可点的设计，但瑜不掩瑕，其槽点之多让人忍不住想要打个差评好好说道说道。

1.异常不合理的数值，多动症到离谱的boss以及仿佛断了腿一般的主角性能。玩家作为一个高贵的吸血鬼，也是人见狗嫌走到哪被打到哪，机动性比隔壁魂游的不死人都要差的多的多。平时顶着残疾人的移速跑图就已经无比折磨了，打boss时更是只能依靠cd10秒以上的闪现来躲避攻击，背板躲招式几乎是刚需。而对比鲜明的是boss各种位移闪现aoe，快到根本看不清抬手的大范围攻击以及一刀砍一半血的离谱伤害技能比比皆是：制作组对boss的理解显然还停留在力大砖飞上，所谓的残酷模式就是闭着眼睛填数值，甚至多人打boss的体验远不如单人来的舒适，不仅boss的血量会超级加倍，满场不间断召唤的小怪和额外招式也是恶心至极。

2.后期极度枯燥乏味的物资刷取，以及重复度高达100%的科技树系统。整个游戏前中期还算有些新鲜感，但默认设置的合成材料倍率以及制造时间简直让人不知所谓：造一块铁就需要好几分钟，而建筑和武器又需要消耗大量各种不同的物资，导致时间都花在了反复刷取材料等待合成上面。每进入下一个科技阶段，材料其实只是换了个名字以及更加麻烦的获取方式，甚至还得手动去翻箱倒柜的刷取一些进阶材料，才能获得批量制造的许可。如此无聊的重复作业，以及套娃一般合成配方一直持续到了通关为止。此外，游戏后期还有许多明显只是为了拉长游戏时间的恶心设计，例如武器碎片、宝珠随机词条的刷取，还有限时的大地图关卡，每次只能刷取少的可怜的暗影碎片，用量却又多的吓人。

3.为了所谓的pvp平衡性而牺牲的pve体验。这一点是最让人无法理解，游戏内看似有多个法术体系和流派，还有多种武器装备，按理说应该能够支持自由度非常高的bd系统，但制作组侧重pvp的莫名自信让几乎绝大部分的法术都变成了换皮的垃圾，boss无脑免疫控制更是让部分法术显得有些小丑。相似的模板换个颜色改一改词条，就又是一个新法术了；只能装备两个法术的底层逻辑让构筑毫无自由可言，更加不存在什么所谓的法术之间的combo，数值给的也是无比保守，简直是生怕玩家打怪打爽了。

4.不合理的奖励解锁顺序。这游戏的法术是按照等级123的顺序来解锁的，打赢特定的boss可以给一个指定等级的技能点，而每个等级的法术又有好几个——制作组看似贴心地让你有选择优先解锁的权利，但实际上后解锁的技能本就是被玩家淘汰下来的，装备栏又只有两个，导致后解锁的技能点处在一个食之无味，弃之可惜的尴尬境地，塞进boss奖励里多少有些敷衍。此外，游戏的装备分为了不同流派，而高级的衣服也是需要打boss解锁的。策划的大智慧就体现在，他们非常贴心地给你安排了一个线性的解锁顺序，保证你在当前阶段只能先穿着没有任何词条的白板衣服去打boss，然后依次解锁制造台、制造材料1、制造材料2...直到你打完了前面所有的boss，都快要通关这个章节了，你才能做出一套完整的衣服。而这套衣服还没有焐热，当你们打完章节头目后，恭喜你——新的上位白板衣服又出现了，快拿着它去挑战下一章的新boss吧。

...其实还有不少零零散散的槽点，一时半会也想不起来/懒得写了，那就先这样吧。这个游戏明明有不少的优点，但在诸多槽点的结合之下，我的游玩体验并不是很好。考虑到它并不是一个半成品，而是已经开发了多年的游戏，部分问题的出现更是让人难以理解...好消息是目前制作组貌似还在继续更新游戏，这一点确实值得肯定。只能说，希望它早日成为一个更加优秀的游戏吧。 | Bir oyunun grindi bile hiç sıkmaz mı? Bu oyunun sıkmıyor. Atmosferi, combat mekanikleri, base tasarlaması vs. her şeyiyle 10/10. Bayılıyorum sana V Rising. | V Rising é um jogo incrível e muito divertido. Ele oferece uma experiência completa, com a possibilidade de construir castelos lindos e personalizados. It pains me to say this, 'cause I loved the original series of Decision, Every new game was a huge improvement on the older one, but this? this game is just a mess, the gameplay is slow and repetetive, the survivor and camp management is barebone on many aspect, and confusing in other, the combact is primitive, the graphic is meh,the class system is bad, most classes are useless, it was handled better in the The decision 3 installment. also you can't choose your character name, It would have madde sense if you were playng as the major from the previus game, but no, you are a brand new character who has to choose betweeen a bunch of stock names, the customisation is yet another weak aspect, the weapons categorisation is terrible, at least  has few bugs, even if some bugs are very detrimental, while I could easily forgive most of these aspects in the previus installment, since they were free, I can not overlook them in a payd for games, the only hopes is that the Developer rework most of the game mechanis, or implement the workshop so that player can fix the game them self. | Infinitely slower, more sluggish, less fluid, and less interesting than its predecessors. Good graphix, good gameplay, and a perfect time spender. But! I wold say that it shall be even more good if the devs add more story, becouse at times, the game turns more like a routine, rather than adventure. :D | I remember playing the flash-games when I was in high school. Really liked the way the game was structured, especially when it comes to clearing out the areas. This game was a fun throwback to those days. 10/10 would recommend. |    本人是从生死抉择中世纪（或者叫王国大战）过来的老玩家。目前对这一款正统续作也只是浅尝辄止。
   因此对深度游玩或者新玩家可能没什么帮助。但是，对喜欢王国大战的玩家会有用。
   首先就是在游玩侧重点上的区别。中世纪侧重点无疑是战斗，砍砍砍杀杀杀，好不痛快。什么基建仓储，物品管理都很轻描淡写，甚至是没有。主角完全是一人成军，一人成团，就是龙傲天，独自面对百万大军不在话下，后期的乐趣就是在郊区面对尸山血海感受自己的豪气万丈。然而提到血霾，但是截至目前本人所体验到的内容，血霾的进展比较缓慢，作战形式由主角个人换成了小队的形式，个人作战往往十分吃力，领地的开拓也比较缓慢，成长曲线没有像中世纪的那么线性但又富有爽点。（当然可能是因为不熟悉的缘故）
   然后就是画风。这一代变成了3D，表现力一般，属于这个价格的档次。但是讲真，见过了中世纪的独一无二（童年滤镜）的表现力，这一代便显得逊色。尽管中世纪是十余年前的游戏，画质早已落于时代，但是画面张力，主角的力量感，仍然可以让人血脉喷张。我现今仍然记得地震式飞跃在童年带给我的震撼，现在都是我最想学的几个游戏内招式。但是这一代目前尚未见到什么让人眼前一亮的，独具匠心的招式。而且打击感并不充足，很绵软，感觉没有什么挥刀加速度的人体吸收冲击的势能感。
   然后便是防御塔的区别。中世纪的区域规划包含的要素很简单：塔楼，矿井，酒馆。这一代也很简单：驱散器，塔楼，营地。（或许有所遗漏，但是第二个基地暂未见到产出塔楼材料类似的造物。）在这一方面，塔楼的变化很大，富有各自特色的三大武器化成了线性升级的机枪塔。但是一个基地（区域）可以不止有一个塔楼。然后塔楼的开拓区域的功能分散到了主角小队手里。并且因为威胁值的取消，塔楼的主要作用成了防御波次攻击而非镇压威胁。创新肯定是好的，但是过度削减内容深度的创新并不是很受欢迎。
  之后便是主角的个人能力分散到了不同的单位和npc身上。主角不再是工程师兼狂战士兼科学家了。因此这一代将侧重点从战斗爽换成了仓储管理。（个人认为）
  尽管如此，别的不说，这一代的枪支什么的，爽。毕竟中世纪不可能有什么先进的热武器。这一代做的不错，但是弹药有限，跟上一代不同，对于割草玩家而言想必是个缺点。
  但却不失为一款佳作。驱散器什么的确实是让人眼前一亮的设定。然后就是故事和世界观的更新，中世纪的剧情和世界观什么的确实很难比得上这一作。然后游戏还在更新，未来可期。
  本人买下这一代就算对中世纪的赞赏吧！期待工作室做出更多的经典。
  最后吐槽一下，感觉开始菜单界面的主角身体比例好奇怪，从中世纪的硬汉变成了浩克（
  至此便是本人能想到的内容。不知为何，理应游玩通关再写下评测的我突然心血来潮。游玩时间定然式不足的，因此评测肯定存在不少纰漏。除此之外，藉由个人游玩风格的不同，游戏侧重点便不一样。在此欢迎指出问题。
