[url=store.steampowered.com/curator/44228872/]鑑賞家 - 評論扭蛋機 Review Gashapon[/url]
[/quote] | I usually don’t bother chasing achievements in games I don’t enjoy. But Mafia II?
I’ve loved this game ever since I was a kid. And even now, after all these years, it’s still my favourite in the entire franchise.

But here’s the thing—
Even with all that love, Mafia II isn’t perfect. And that’s exactly why I’m writing this review.
Let me tell you why this game has stuck with me for so long… and where it almost lost me.

Mafia II is one of the most fascinating games I’ve ever played. It’s a [b]very linear game masquerading as an open-world sandbox[/b]—kind of like L.A. Noire, but without the investigative depth.

[b]The driving.[/b] Oh boy.
90% of Mafia II is just you driving from Point A to Point B. Watch a cutscene, drive again. Blow up a hotel? Sure. But then, more driving. You are Vito Scaletta—
What? No, I’m not.
[b]Yes, you are. Shut up.[/b]

You’re an upstanding gentleman in the waste management consulting business. Your motivation? [b]Money.[/b] Vito comes back from WWII to find out his dear ol’ dad blew all the family money on booze, took out loans, and then rudely died, leaving the debt to Vito’s family. With his back against the wall, Vito has only one option left: working a 9-to-5.

[b]But wait![/b]
Lucky for Vito, he’s got his buddy Joe Barbaro—a man so resourceful, he might as well be the richest guy in Empire Bay. Joe hooks Vito up with a place to live, some cash, a car, a gun, and job connections. Honestly, at this point, I wondered why Joe didn’t just pay the debts himself. But hey, [b]this is where the fun begins.[/b]
And by fun, I mean… more driving.

[h2] Money, Money, Money… and More Driving [/h2]
Money-making in Mafia II is limited. Besides paying off your family’s debt, you can splurge on guns, suits, and upgrading your car. But earning money? Mostly through story missions. You can "borrow" from shopkeepers or do odd jobs at the scrapyard, but nothing beats just progressing the story.

Here’s where it gets weird:
You can earn more than enough money to pay off the family debt early in the game. But you can’t pay it off until the story lets you because… plot reasons. Vito needs to get arrested, go to prison, and learn who’s boss in the iron hotel.

Play for five minutes, and you’ll feel it: [b]2K Czech had big plans for Mafia II[/b], but a lot was cut. There’s leftover dialogue, hinted mechanics, and implied features that never made it in. The game doesn’t feel incomplete, but you can’t help but wonder what could’ve been.

And then you discover the [b]DLCs[/b]—
Joe’s Adventures , The Betrayal of Jimmy and Jimmy's vendetta
My advice? [b]Don’t.[/b]
They’re atrocious. Imagine GTA III mission design, but with timers slapped on everything. Tailing missions with a timer? Who thought that was a good idea?

[h2] Driving: The Real Main Character [/h2]
Let’s talk about the driving mechanics since that’s 90% of your playtime. Without driving, Mafia II would be a 30-minute game. But you know what? [b]The driving is great.[/b]

If you liked GTA IV’s driving, you’ll feel right at home. The 1940s-50s cars feel weighty, clunky, and require actual skill to handle. The attention to detail in the vehicles is incredible, and the ability to shoot gas tanks and make cars explode adds a tactical layer to combat.

But it’s not just the cars. [b]The city feels alive.[/b]
The police will pull you over for speeding or running red lights. There’s even a button to cap your speed limit so you can avoid fines. It’s funny—this game about crime has you constantly obeying traffic laws. But it works. It makes Empire Bay feel like a real, living city.

[h2] Combat: From Fists to Firefights [/h2]
The [b]melee combat?[/b]
Imagine L.A. Noire’s boxing mixed with Yakuza’s heat moves. Early on, fights feel like two old guys arguing at a pub. But once Vito learns counter-attacks in prison (midway through the game), combat becomes smoother and more satisfying.

[b]Gunfights[/b] are rare but impactful. When they happen, they’re intense and well-designed. The weapon selection is limited, but honestly, it’s all you need. Pistols, shotguns, Tommy guns, and rifles—simple but effective. However, half the guns feel redundant, and ammo is sometimes annoyingly scarce.

[h2] The Story: The Game’s True Heart [/h2]
While the gameplay has its ups and downs, [b]the story is where Mafia II shines.[/b]
The characters are memorable, the cutscenes are well-directed, and the atmosphere of post-war America is beautifully captured. Vito’s journey from a struggling veteran to a made man is compelling, even if the linear structure feels restrictive at times.

[h1] My Final Thoughts [/h1]
Mafia II is a game I had a loved since I was a kid. At first, I kinda disliked the linearity and repetitive driving. But as I got older and replayed it with a more patient mindset every year near christmas , I realized how unique and special it is.

It’s not perfect.
It’s not as open-ended as it pretends to be.
But it’s [b]an unforgettable experience[/b]—one that stands out in the crowded world of open-world crime games.

If you haven’t played it yet, give it a shot. And if you played it before and didn’t like it, maybe give it another chance.

[b]Verdict:[/b]
[i]8/10[/i] – Drive carefully, mafioso. | ---{ Graphics }---

Too bad on my new pc it just bugs when the police wants to arrest you so sadly no replay :(

The best mafia game in the series. Brilliant story, amazing setting, one of my favourites ive played through a million times (my first start-up of the remaster recently and I love it! It does look & sound better - so it modernises it a little). The crash bug did happen to me, as with everyone else and was so annoying but can be stopped easily..

You can get around the annoying crashes on start-up by blocking all outgoing traffic for the game in windows firewall:
In Windows Defender Firewall, delete all "Mafia II: Definitive edition" inbound rules, and right-click outbound rules > New rule > create an outbound rule > Program > Select Mafia's exe file located in the install folder > Action - "Block the connection". You can still unlock achievements, it will just lock out 2k's rubbish and prevent login - which is no bad thing anyway as all it is doing is sending you adverts on the main menu... lol | Испортили офигенную игру. Просто говнище, симулятор багов. Решил поиграть в этот шедевр, но сначала пришлось бороться с вылетами в главном меню, исправил. После чего пришлось менять язык, поменял. Уже прошел две главы, захожу в игру на следующий день и оказывается просто напросто ничего не сохранилось! Замечательно вообще блять! Пришлось искать решение проблемы, опять же, САМОМУ, но тут мне уже ничего не помогло. И самое смешное, что в интернете просто тысячи отзывов по поводу этих проблем. Но этим даунам из 2K просто похуй, они за 4 года не смогли исправить эти проблемы. За то экранчик добавили в главном меню блять!! Ставлю 10 вылетов из 10 | Після прекрасної першої частини серії, пограти в Mafia II було наче вступити в гівно. В старі часи ця гра мені взагалі не сподобалась, але тут я вирішив пройти всю трилогію, і може дати їй ще один шанс, адже мене здивувала велика кількість фанів. Результат лише підтвердив початкові враження: це відстій. Я рідко пишу негативні рецензії, але це саме той випадок. 

[h2]Ремастер: технічний жах. [/h2]

Це кривий, забагований плювок у вічі від розробників. Гра вилітає в меню, мова не змінюється, певні глави доводиться перепроходити через безкінечні завантаження. Аудіовізуальні баги, такі як проблеми з волоссям, збої озвучування чи потрапляння у текстури, вже навіть не дивують. 2К забили болт на всі ці проблеми, бо судячи з форумів, це глобальні речі, що відбуваються уже дуже давно у більшості гравців. Щодо графіки — вона майже не відрізняється від оригіналу.

[h2]Геймплей: рутина й одноманітність. [/h2]

Основна частина ігрового процесу — це їзда на машині, що займає 70%+ ігрового часу. В цей час поки їздимо туди-назад через всю мапу, любуємось нудним відкритим світом та слухаємо жарти про те, що водимо тачку як бабця Джо. Весь інший час слухаємо жарти про те, що стріляємо, як сестра Джо. Іноді дають пограти в стелс, весь інший час стріляємо з-за хованок. Ніякої динаміки геймплею немає - що було на початку, те буде і в кінці, тому жодна місія не здається унікальною. 

[h2]Сюжет: з’явився і зник [/h2]

Вибачте, будуть спойлери. Історія розповідає про типовий шлях бандита, який постійно потрапляє в проблеми через компанію, і завжди розгрібає наслідки чужих дій. За 13 годин я вбив 685 ворогів - абсурд.  Спочатку сюжет здається навіть логічним, і є надія на світле майбутнє у гри, але далі картковий будиночок обвалюється.
Преамбула кінцівки з наркотиками та федеральним кротом - висосана з пальця, конфлікт із тріадами взагалі виглядає штучно вставленим задля якоїсь драми, однак самої ж драми не стається. Чому я почав з кінцівки? Бо основна лінія це просто біготня головного героя під дудку всіх трьох сімей Емпайр-Бей, в тій чи іншій мірі, без жодних моральних дилем, та при повній однобокості. Типові базові завдання - убиваєш шісток, убиваєш головну ціль - поїхали додому спати.
Сама ж кінцівка незграбна та розмита, доля героїв залишається вам на догадки (і на третю частину, як я розумію). Багато фонових подій та персонажів теж залишаються без уваги, наприклад, сестри Віто, і навіть відсилка до "Хрещеного батька" не рятує ситуацію. Історія повернення Лео Галанте (що відсилає нас до Френка з першої частини) - а на біса нам це знати :) Просто отримайте героя знову. 
Час від часу виникають питання в доцільності деяких ігрових механік, як допустим грошей, додаткових способів заробітку, чи заправок авто. Самий знаковий випадок в мене: Віто втрачає житло, Джо пропонує йому халупу, по дорозі до цього житла я заробляю декілька тисяч доларів і тут же герой жаліється на відсутність грошей для готелю. Я розумію що це скрипт, однак комічність ситуації від цього нікуди не зникає. 
Найбільша проблема — це сам Віто. Він залишається порожнім героєм від самого початку до самого кінця. У нього немає власної думки, внутрішніх конфліктів чи чогось, що робило б його цікавим. Він — просто виконавець завдань, маріонетка в руках мафіозного світу. 

[h2]Позитивні моменти[/h2]

Похвалити можу лише за цікаві колекційні предмети (хехе). Складність на рівні Hard адекватна, фізика авто на реалістичному режимі дуже приємна. 

[h2]Висновок[/h2]

Mafia II могла бути гідним продовженням першої частини, але на ділі все вийшло зовсім гірше. Можна проводити багато паралелей сюжету, і скрізь він буде слабшим. Технічні проблеми, поверхнева історія, нудний геймплей і відсутність належного розвитку персонажів роблять цю гру важкою для проходження, чисто главу в день проходив і вимикав. Усі її позитивні моменти губляться в морі нецікавості.

Рекомендувати не можу, але якщо ви фанат, що готовий закрити очі на всі проблеми, то залишайтесь таким. Іншим з дещицею здорового глузду і критичним мисленням - краще уникати. | （5h）在这冰面上开车真不习惯，性能极差，而且车辆不像一代最终版有档位可以调节，操作手感和体验不如第一代最终版。

（16h）出狱以后路况和车辆性能好很多了，不过有两个恶性BUG无论如何得说一下，第一个就是地图同时出现了两个粉红目的地，一个是主线任务标，一个是卡了BUG的餐馆标，然后还有第14章对话语音重叠的问题，这个无大碍，但是另一个就很糟心了，当我送完乔去医生那，准备去还钱，到达目的地以后，门竟然触发不了，这是什么意思，我还得重新第14章再来一遍吗？

（18h）关于第14章，准备还钱结果卡在破巷子打不开门的解决方法，首先忍痛重新载入第14章，是的，重新开始第14章，然后解决完一系列事情，把码头老板干掉拿完那两万块以后，直接去北边大叔的废车碾压机卖车赚钱，一定记住，路上千万不要抢劫商店，不然你又会陷入卡在那个破巷子无法开门的困境之中。

（20h）一直到最后，我都还以为维托会开门跳车，然后右上角出现一个30秒的倒计时把乔给救下，唉，看来我还是想多了。 | Game crashes on startup when I close the 2k account login window on the main menu.

Intense campaign, Seat grasping battles,  well speculated gameplay, and easy to manage micro units 
this game gets a 

10/10 when Japan is either on my team or not in the match at all

and a 

9/10 when Japan is against me. | R.U.S.E. is a strategy game that is based off of world war 2. There are a HUGE amount of things that are just awesome about this game.

Imagine that you are a general, leading the American army, and you find out you are up against the germans. You build your base and eventually start building some units. You use some RUSES (which are kinda like special tactics, only every faction has these) and find the enemy base. Then suddenly, a group of panzer IV's goes on a rampage in your base, but you survive. You start building anti-tank units and recon units to see where they are coming from. You see that they are using tanks along with air support. You see that there is a flaw with this, as they don't have any long range support, so you build some artillery (suprisingly, they work kinda like wargame. Long range, but only effective against large groups of units and buildings.) You start sending volley after volley against the enemy base, so he is forced to counter this. Meanwhile, you start building your own tanks and infantry, and while he is busy tracking down your artillery and trying to counter it, you attack. His Panzars, weakened by the barrage, fall easily to your Sherman medium tanks and you destroy his base, winning the match.

The units are actually accurate to history, meaning they have their own strengths and weaknesses that are reasonable. For ex: tanks are excellent against infantry and other tanks, but are no match to fighter-bombers. Another example are the bombers. They are slow and can't defend themselves from fighters, so you have to escort them with fighters.

I haven't really tried the multiplayer out yet, but it seems pretty good.

The graphics are awesome in this game. You can see the explosions up close, with all of the dirt and debris flying all over the place. The units are also detailed, you can see the damage as units like tanks and other vehicles look more and more beaten up as they get shot at. The is awesome to look at, especially up close. The camera actually shakes from the impact of tank shells and heavy artillery and the explosions are just beautiful to look at, even at low graphics.

The damage is also effective. Certain units have more firepower than others, making them really effective at what they do, especially the units that you can get later in the game. Like the Germans King Tiger and the Americans Pershing heavy tank. One of these things could hold off against at least 4 medium tanks before they succumb.

There are also experimental units that are in this. The super pershing for the Americans is one of the most powerful tank in the American arsenal, but you need to get a experimental factory in order to make one. Experimental units can range from super-heavy artillery to anti-air guns that can wipe the sky clean of even the biggest squadrons of bombers single handedly. 

Overall, this game has a very good impression. You can have firefights that can last from 5 seconds to 20 minutes if you aren't careful. The graphics are amazing to look at. The overall strategy required for this game is tremendous, as every unit has a purpous and even one unit can ruin your chances of winning the game. 

I rate this game a 9.5/10.

P.S. There are a few things that make this different from Wargame. Like the fact that you don't have a limit to how many units you have or can have. | Steps on how to R.U.S.E.
1.) Get some friends to play with you
2.) Beat the bots on hard
3.) Think you're the best at this game
4.) Join an online match
5.) Build some supply depots
6.) Sit there helplessly while they are blown up
7.) Realize the only people who play this game are already Gods at it
8.) Continue playing against bots for the rest of your life, and never exit the safety of a private match.

I absolutely adore Dead Space 2. It is one of my favourite games of all time and I have nearly 200 hours on it across different platforms. Near perfect Action Horror, through and through.
However as of 02/02/25 I cannot recommend this game to anyone with Windows 11 and/or newer hardware like Intel i9 CPU's (10+ cores is a MAJOR ISSUE) or Nvidia 40 series GPU's, as it absolutely refuses to run longer than 20 minutes without either soft or hardlocking your PC, and that's even if you can get it to boot in the first place. I have spent many hours trying numerous combinations of fixes for things such as framerate, controls, graphical errors, DLC removal, Inaccessible bonus rooms and so... SO MUCH more, to absolutely no avail.
Please do not waste your time with this version of the game until EA pull their thumb out of their bunghole and fix their game.

EDIT: 12 hours after I wrote this review, I managed to stabilise DS2 enough to play it for an hour without any crashes. 
If you do attempt to get this game working on a PC with more than 10 CPU cores, you must download Windows ADK Compatibility Manager and create your own database fix that tricks your PC into thinking it has less cores than it actually does. Then, you must lock your all software and hardware to run at 60fps and turn off V-SYNC. I'd recommend replacing your EXE with v1.0 to remove the DLC packs and manually replacing/renaming the DATA files in order to unlock the previously inaccessible Conduit Rooms.
So with a bit of work, you can get this game working. But there is still no Severed DLC solution so EA can suck my nuts, the negative review stays. | Cumple, pero hasta ahi nomas. Portal 2 is one of the best puzzle games ever created. It combines logical thinking, physics-based mechanics, and an engaging story. The game takes place in Aperture Science, a mysterious and dangerous laboratory filled with test chambers. The player controls Chell, a silent protagonist who must escape using the Portal Gun. This device allows players to create two linked portals on surfaces, making it possible to teleport and solve puzzles.

One of the most impressive aspects of Portal 2 is its level design. Each test chamber introduces new mechanics, forcing players to think creatively. The game starts with simple puzzles but gradually becomes more complex. Elements like light bridges, propulsion gel, and lasers add depth to the challenges. The difficulty curve is perfect, making the game enjoyable for both beginners and experienced players.

Portal 2 also stands out with its story and humor. The main antagonist, GLaDOS, is a sarcastic and witty AI who constantly insults and manipulates the player. Wheatley, a clumsy and funny robot, adds another layer of comedy. Their dialogues make the game more entertaining and memorable. Despite its humor, the story also explores themes of control, identity, and artificial intelligence.

Another great feature of Portal 2 is its cooperative mode. Unlike the single-player campaign, co-op requires teamwork and communication. Players control two robots, Atlas and P-Body, solving puzzles that require coordination. This mode enhances the experience, making it even more enjoyable when played with a friend.

Overall, Portal

The painting of this game as "reverse tower defense" demonstrates an utter lack of understanding firstly of what tower defense means, and secondly, of the long and storied history of Qix and it's many many clones. 

Make no mistake, this game has nothing to do with the tower defense genre, and everything to do with being a shameless re-imagining of the classic 8-bit game Qix. That sounds like it would be a bad thing, but the truth is that Qix was a rad game when it released in 1981, and Fortix 2 truly feels like what would happen if the developers of Qix had time-traveled 30 years into the future at the start of development. 

Qix featured a simple mechanic, slickly implemented, with a presentation that was unremarkable but serviceable for its day. The exact same thing is true for Fortix 2. This is not a complicated game, but it is a great implementation of a simple mechanic. The difficulty curve is pitch-perfect, making finishing a level without losing any lives achievable but challenging. 

Fortix 2 isn't going to blow anyone away, but it does an excellent job of filling that spot in your Steam library for a game that doesn't ask for much in the way of investment, and can be consumed in 5-minute increments while still feeling rewarding, and for $2 or less, you can't really ask for more. | This game is sooo enjoyable! its also srsly a good choice if you dont want to use your mouse! 基本システムは前作とほぼ同様ですがルールは若干変更され
特定のアイテムを獲得することと砲台を殲滅させればクリアです
敵を中心としたシステムではないため陣地は小さい方に分割されます

制限マップや陣取り不可オブジェなどがあったりします
やる事がマップごとに大して変わらないため若干退屈だった
前作に比べ追加要素のおかげで根本的に異なる攻略が必要に
なるなど良いアクセントになっています

ちなみになんと定価が$2になっており大変お買い得になっています
バンドルに入ったりセールだと$1だったりするのでお気軽にどうぞ
Fortix1は更に安いですが主要ステージは今作にclassicsとして
収録されているためこちらだけでも十分だったりします


ここから先はimpossible等の高難易度の話

前作同様高難易度になると高頻度に高速弾や高速誘導弾が砲台から発射されますが
これが非常に曲者で規則性がないため完全に安全行動を取るには場所によって
2ドット程度の前進しか出来ない場所があったりします

ノーミスでいくにはかなり慎重に行動を取らねばならないにも
関わらず今作は制限時間がかなり厳しく調整されており慎重かつ素早く
といった作業をドット単位の精密コントロールで行う必要があります
ほんの3ドット進んだだけでもすぐ側の砲台が弾を出せば終わりという
凄まじい不条理感を味わうこともままあります

ちなみに1同様私の環境だとキーボードが安物なためかどうにも入力がうまくいかないことが
あるためそういった操作ミスがあると尚更しんどくなってしまいます
高難易度をやりこむ場合にはレスポンスがしっかりしたKBかコントローラー推奨です

また左上等の2箇所同時押しをした場合には先に押した方向に入力が入り続けます
このため上、左、下と移動して陣を最小限で取りたい時にちょっとでも同時入力があると
その分移動距離が伸びてしまいそれが原因で事故ることになります
後に押した方に移動してくれれば操作性でストレスがかかることはなさそうなのですが…
ただ必ず先に横に拡大しておきそれから前進するジグザク法を使えばそれも問題はありません

かなり高難易度でありながらレスポンスにちょっと不満があるという感じなので
クリア後も達成感というよりはやっと片付いたという感じの方が強いです
高難易度はよっぽどマゾな方か修行僧の方以外にはお勧めできません

Critical Mass is an action puzzle game where you match colored blocks to remove them.  The more of a color you remove, the bigger the combo. This review is from a disabled gamer (I only play with a mouse).

http://youtu.be/a6Kdsyvsaks

Loading the game, you can easily access options and change the game to Windowed Mode.  Windowed Mode is borderless so you can change windows without exiting the game.  There's multiple resolutions you can set the window too.  It also has Colorblind Mode which adds a symbol in addiction to the blocks color.  Another option I was impressed with was the Mouse Button option that let's you swap each buttons role.  There's also a single option for the mouse but it seemed to be picky on exactly where I cllicked which slowed me down.  I opt'd to keep using  the reversed option.

Actual game modes include Classic, Survival, Meditation and Rush.  While most modes do require you to work within various time tables, Meditation is a completely untimed relaxing strategic gameplay.  To play the game, rotate the mass with your left mouse button and place blocks with your right mouse button. Many games actually didn't require much rotation so I completed many levels using only 1 mouse button.

If you're a mouse user who can left & right click gameplay should be a breeze!  Colorblind gamers should also be fine with colorblind option enabled.  It's actually my favorite way to play. | I hate bashing on Ozzie companies. ;p And this isn't an evil, unplayable game. My first impression was good, I played it for a bit, expected to play more, had it installed forever, yet every time I fire it up, I close it after 5 minutes.

It's a match 3 game with some 3D tetris elements. The concept is good. The graphics are polished. The music isn't bad. The controls feel annoying at first, but they're actually mostly okay. The problem is, the gameplay doesn't feel satisfying. It expects (and rewards, scorewise) big combos and long term strategy. It also expects you to be fast and responsive. This should theoretically work, in that zen-like way games like this work, but it doesn't. The rythym and pacing feels all off, it feels like the speed jumps from 1,2,3,4,5 to 50 to 150. Once you get into the zone and start planning ahead for later big score combos, it feels like you blink and the game jumps speed, asking you to go for quick, "just don't make a mistake" placement. That may be totally subjective of course, or it could be that the feeling gets exacerbated by the clunky cube placement process. It simply isn't visually always obvious or easy to correctly target the location you want on a constantly rotating cube, which really hurts the game when it picks up speed. People misplace blocks on tetris too, but usually feel it's their fault, here it feels like the cube jumps place three times before you can be sure it's where it should be. By which time the game has jumped two speed gears and you're basically done with.

Again, not a bad game, in theory. I just never feel like playing it long, because it doesn't feel very enjoyable. The thumbs down is just trying to balance a "very positively" reviewed game, with an 80 something metacritic score that few people seem to actually play much (notice the curiously short play times of the majority of the positive reviewers?). So I'd suggest to approach with caution, and at least play the demo first. | They weren't kidding when they wrote up the description for this little gem. Brutally simple to learn, simply brutal to master, Critical Mass is the kind of game literally anybody can just pick up and waste hours upon hours of their lives playing, all in a vain attempt to top the charts. And don't think for a second I mean any of that in a bad way. Far from it; Critical Mass possesses a fun, addictive quality rivaled only by the likes of Tetris and similar titles.

In case you still have doubts, bear in mind that this game only costs a measely two bucks, so it won't be a serious dent in your pocketbook even if you turn out to be one of the four or five people globally who don't enjoy it (you know who you are). With that in mind, what do you have to lose? I pride myself for being more discriminating than most when it comes to choosing which games to buy with a rather limited budget, so believe me when I say Critical Mass is a nearly fool-proof purchase! | I keep getting this error when I start the game:

[b]Unable to connect to game server.
Online Ranking, Skillpoints and Achievements are unavailable in Offline mode.[/b]

This game is advertised on Steam store page as having Steam Achievements. But that is misleading since those achievements along with skill points are blocked because the game can't go online anymore. I thought this was a normal single-player puzzle game. Why does it need to be online? This game shouldn't be allowed to be sold in its current state. Anyway, I won't be financing this scam so I asked for a refund. | Цветные объёмные кубики-рубики.....интригует, не так ли?

В действительности, перед нами увлекательная аркада, её сложно назвать офисной, ибо нужно постоянное сосредоточение и быстрая реакция. А главное - играя вы получаете определённое удовольствие, а впечатления выкинутого времени нет. Также не стоит забывать про разные режимы игры. 

Достигните критической массы! 7,5 из 10 :)

Limbo is a timeless indie masterpiece that redefined the puzzle-platformer genre with its minimalist yet deeply atmospheric approach. Developed by Playdead, the game immerses players in a haunting monochromatic world filled with mystery and danger.

The striking black-and-white visuals, combined with a chillingly minimalist sound design, create an eerie and unsettling atmosphere that grips you from start to finish. The puzzles are clever, intuitive, and seamlessly tied to the environment, offering just the right balance of challenge and satisfaction.

What makes Limbo stand out is its ability to tell a profound, thought-provoking story without a single word of dialogue. Its themes of survival, loss, and exploration resonate deeply, making it more than just a game, it's an experience.

For fans of atmospheric and emotionally driven games, Limbo is an absolute must-play. Its influence on the indie game scene is undeniable, and its haunting world will stay with you long after you’ve reached the end. | 有些地方纯粹是恶心人的，搞那种很极限的操作，这又不是跑酷游戏，况且操作本来就不流畅 | 知道为什么最后通关的人只有不到1/3吗（通关成就玩家29%），因为全部通关之后最后的剧情部分卡住了，要么调低帧率（看别人说这么搞可以，我自己调到60帧也没用，该卡还是卡），要么不断esc当ppt来看（为了一个成就我真是这么搞得，连点器都搞了半小时）
游戏嘛，最开始感觉设计挺巧妙的，很多用物理原理才能搞过去，但玩到后面的时候真的玩不下去了，就感觉设计师只在按他的想法走，关卡设计的一个比一个阴间，没引导好累，最后五关全部看攻略过的，虽然看攻略时能感受到巧妙，但确实也能感受到无语，就是图上没有任何引导，哪怕暗示啥的都没有，但的确又有一个新的空间你不知道，没有空间里的箱子你通不了关……
只能说好坏参半吧，刚开始觉得新鲜有趣，好巧妙啊；后面感觉本来就是小游戏的简单重复还藏着掖着，不给你提示，让你去猜，我猜nm呢的感觉 | LIMBO, zorlu ve zaman zaman sinir bozucu bulmacalarıyla dikkat çekiyor. Ufak hatalar sizi en başa döndürebilir, ancak bu da oyunun heyecanını artırıyor. Farklı gizli bölgeleri keşfederek başarımlar kazanabilirsiniz. INSIDE kadar keyifli olmasa da daha zorlu bulmacalar ve farklı bir tema sunuyor. Keyifli ama bir o kadar da sabır gerektiren bir deneyim. | 比起inside，这部的全成就堪称恶心至极，隐藏关卡玩得窝火，死亡少于五次通关那个更是沙比

Интересный представитель жанра, но для первого знакомства не рекомендую.
Контента не очень много, если сравнивать со среднестатистическими конкурентами, вроде "Plants vs. Zombies", "Defender's Quest" и даже "Space Run". И я сравниваю именно с играми в жанре башенной защиты, хотя это не точное сравнение, ведь "Orcs Must Die!" скорее боевик от третьего лица.
Оценивать игру в сравнении с другими похожими не хочется, потому что они будут иметь, очевидно, похожие недостатки. А оценивать в вакууме, в отрыве ото всех игр вообще - тоже, потому что персонаж там уже изолирован на небольших аренах, как в серии Painkiller.
Баги портят общее впечатление - от проваливающихся в текстуры врагов до люстр, замирающих при падении в баррикадах. Был даже баг, когда началась новая волна, хотя у прежней всё ещё был живой и здравствующий гоблин-шаман.
Поиск пути у врагов периодами выдаёт финты и заставляет застревать в самых неожиданных местах.
Баланс тоже далёк от творческой свободы - при кажущемся обилии ловушек, оружия, стражей и улучшений, у них не так много гибкости при размещении, и синергии между всем этим обилием очень мало.

Основной шарм в юморе и динамике, в постоянном давлении со стороны противника, а также в относительной свежести подхода на период выхода игры. Однако основная идея всех игр жанра Tower Defense в том, что игрок доминирует над положением и выстраивает большей частью автономную защиту, тогда как эта игра ближе к боевику, учитывая количество урона, которое должен наносить сам главный персонаж, бегая по арене, и возможностей выстроить автономную защиту здесь нет. Если же сравнивать игру с другими боевиками, то эта постоянная изоляция делает её очень скудной и однообразной.
Ярым поклонникам жанра, конечно же, лучше ознакомиться; тем более, если на всю серию уже регулярны высокие скидки от 80% и более. | Como la mayoría, habrán jugado este juego en versión pirata sin completar el juego. Ahora que lo tengo acá y lo completé, pues si valió la pena. (Consejo: mejora si o si a los guardianes, me lo agradeceras). | Es entretenido, aunque se le notan mucho los años y que fue la base para esta saga. El 2 es bastante mejor a pesar de no tener mucha diferencia entre entregas, y además tiene cooperativo (cosa que el primero no tiene) así que recomendaría jugar a este solo si tienes curiosidad por como fue el primero. | 童年经典塔防游戏了，自己是从二代跟基友联机开始入坑的，现在正版补票，只可惜这代只能单人游玩。 | I'm not super great at this game, and though I wanted to play more of it I just didn't have the time it takes to put into it. That said, I think it's pretty well made and does everything you'd want it to for this type of tower defense game. I really hope someday I can get back to it and really get into this series.

[h1]Sobrevive a tus decisiones: un retrato de la muerte y la humanidad [/h1]
[u]Puntos Positivos:[/u]
[list]
    [*][b]Un apocalipsis con una carga emocional brutal:[/b] Más allá de los zombis, el verdadero terror del juego es la lucha por la humanidad. Cada decisión que tomes no solo afectará tu supervivencia, sino también la de tu grupo. El vínculo entre Lee y Clementine es la pieza fundamental  del juego, creando una de las historias más conmovedoras de todos los videojuegos que he probado.

    [*][b]Decisiones cruciales:[/b] Telltale logró que cada elección se sintiera importante. Desde diálogos tensos hasta momentos de vida o muerte, siempre estarás al borde de la incertidumbre. ¿A quién salvarás? ¿En quién confiarás? El juego te obliga a reflexionar sobre tus propias decisiones morales.

    [*][b]Personajes que se sienten vivos:[/b] Cada personaje tiene personalidad, motivaciones y un papel en la historia. No todos estarán de acuerdo contigo, y algunos recordarán tus decisiones para bien o para mal. No es solo un juego de zombis, es un juego de personas.

    [*][b]Banda sonora que te eriza la piel:[/b] Las actuaciones de voz están llenas de emoción, y la música acompaña perfectamente cada escena, intensificando la desesperación y la tristeza del apocalipsis.

    [*][b]Rejugabilidad con matices de horror:[/b] Aunque la historia tiene un camino general, tus elecciones pueden cambiar ciertos eventos, relaciones y reacciones. Esto hace que quieras volver a jugar para explorar diferentes posibilidades y cargar con el peso de nuevas decisiones.
[/list]

[u]Puntos Negativos:[/u]
[list]
    [*][b]Un estilo artístico con altibajos:[/b] El cel-shading le da un toque de cómic al juego, pero las animaciones pueden sentirse toscas en algunos momentos. En ciertas escenas, la falta de fluidez puede sacarte de la inmersión.

    [*][b]Libertad con paredes invisibles:[/b] El juego te vende la idea de que tus decisiones lo cambian todo, pero en algunos momentos el desenlace será el mismo sin importar lo que hagas. A veces se siente más como una ilusión de control.

    [*][b]Bugs mínimos[/b] Telltale tenía fama de problemas técnicos, y este juego no es la excepción. Desde caídas de rendimiento hasta errores en la carga de partidas, algunos problemas pueden afectar la experiencia.
[/list]

[hr][/hr]

Si buscas una historia que te haga sentir, sufrir y cuestionarte, The Walking Dead 1 es una experiencia inolvidable. No es solo un juego, es un viaje emocional que deja cicatrices. A pesar de sus problemas técnicos, su narrativa y personajes lo convierten en un título imprescindible.

Но к пятой части меня ждало разочарование при выборе неизбежном, роман с н е г р о м или же стать лесбухой. я разочарован ибо такое ощущение что ее история стала менее про нее саму и больше про выполнение условий гендер pedikov. Quase 13 anos jogando esse jogo na pirataria e assistindo vários streamers/youtubers jogando, agora estou finalmente jogando twd oficialmente, não tem como esquecer do primeiro jogo que você chorou. Essa franquia e os personagens são muito especiais para mim e tenho um carinho enorme com a comunidade de jogadores que amam esse jogo.

Praticamente um dos pioneiros dos jogos de escolhas narrativos desse estilo de 'apontar e clicar' (acho que o primeiro foi Heavy Rain), The Walking Dead da Telltale sempre será atemporal com sua narrativa, depois de jogar acho que vai ser difícil esquecer do jogo de zumbi com a menina do boné com um D na estampa chamada Clementine e seu salvador Lee Everett.

Incrível do começo ao fim, bem construído com 4 episódios com inicio, meio e 'continua no próximo episódio' perfeitos para te fazer continuar a jogar, e o quinto episódio te fazendo jogar o segundo jogo.

When you’ve managed to create an unexpectedly great first entry for a franchise, it begs the question: What the hell do you do with the sequel? In the case of Borderlands 2 developer Gearbox has decided to largely stick with what worked the first time around, while implementing a host of tweaks that make it an overall superior game. A few relatively minor complaints aside, Borderlands 2 improves not only the narrative, but almost every major game system. If you’ve been itching for a reason to jump back into the world of Pandora, Borderlands 2 provides a more than ample supply.The hook of Borderlands 2, the very reason that I found myself thinking about it when I worked or tried to fall asleep, is the loot. Guns, ammo, character skins, grenade mods, class mods -- there’s always something just a bit better, something you so desperately didn’t even know you needed until you found it in Borderlands 2. Just like Diablo or a number of other action RPGs, the hunt for loot becomes intoxicating because of the tiny rush you get each time a rare colored item spills out of a chest or is dropped by a recently slain enemy. Every firefight and intense boss battle becomes all the more rewarding, because, though you might die a few times and want to crush something near you in real life, it suddenly feels like everything is going to be OK when you’re blasting away enemies with a newly looted gun. | só tem gente perturbada, armas, violência, animais perigosos, uma milicia que quer controlar tudo, nenhum policial á vista e um ambiente inóspito a vida humana.

If you have never played it, I highly recommend you do. Even if the game was at its retail price from 2014 it'd still be better than the dumpster fire that is Borderlands 3. | Bitch ass uses horrible shift server instead of reliable steam server and now co op is unplayable

У цілому, суть гри зводиться до одноманітного знищення мобів і босів та лутінгу. І якщо з останнім усе чудово — гра пропонує багато цікавих предметів і можливостей для їх покращення — то баланс у боях на рівні майстер залишає бажати кращого. Спочатку проходиш гру комфортно, без особливих труднощів, а потім  раптово зустрічаєш рівень, або боса, який буквально вичавлює з тебе всі наявні ресурси. Сюжет цілком нормальний для такого жанру, графіка хороша, анімації скілів чудові, та й у цілому прокачування кожного персонажа цікаве. Загалом, класно, що розробники створили щось нове, самостійне й не схоже на інші вчесвіти, але реалізація вийшла трохи сируватою — чогось не вистачає, а щось, навпаки, варто було б доопрацювати. | the art is great, and the ideas for the game are fun. かつて存在したF2PのRTSです。現在はサービス終了となりました。
なんか中途半端なレビューがのこっているので最後に更新しておこうかと..
まあ個人的には500時間程度プレイしているのでかなり楽しんだ方です。
課金もsteamでセールやっていたときに二つほど買いました。
(3つの課金文化の追加と課金で追加される3つのゲームモードかな)
その他の課金はしていません。

ちなみに私個人の腕前は正直決してうまい人といえないばかりか
普通に対戦すると数分でつぶされるレベルです。
序盤戦略は固まっていたのでその手順を理解して以下にそれを効率よく配分するか..
このタイプのものは全部そうなる可能性が高そうですね。
成長速度が段違いすぎてcoopやる時に散々迷惑かけました。
そしてそこまで腕を磨かないままプレイを続けたので
難易度高いミッションは序盤で時間かかりすぎて敵につぶされる感じでした。
ちょっとコツを教えてもらった時は下の上ぐらいにはなったが..

最終的には一応すべての文化をレベル最大にしました。
おそろく実装されたクエストはギリシャ文化で95%ぐらいまではクリアしています。
でもレベル最大になるとでてくる勢力争いはフレンドが誘ってくれたものと
簡単ではないが攻略方があるもの以外はクリアはできなかったです。
また、このゲームはアイテム、アドバイザーなどで同一文化でも
もっている人ともってない人では差がでてました。
一応全部ではないですがそれを売ったり、買ったり、交換することは可能です。
トレードチャットに張り付いた時期もありました。

あんまり高い評価は得られなかったですが結構面白かったです。
いろいろ特殊なゲームモードなども作ろうとした時期もありましたが
初期の失敗が響いて結局それを十分に取り返せなかった感じでしょうか？
またはやりがDotAやLoLなどのタイプになって
こういう全体に気を配っていくタイプが敬遠されるようになったのかな..
という感じでした。

GfWLでしたので実績解除にも結構励んだ記憶あり..
最後にいろいろやろうとしたけど残っていたのが
ちょっと時間的にも実力的にも無理だったので早々に諦めたな.. | A good try for the survival of RTS in modern era.

I've played over 1000 hours of this game. I've seen it from it's conception to it's end. 
The community of this game is unlike any other I've ever encountered in an online group. They are vindictive, rude and destructive to the game. Throughout the entire time I played I suffered no end of trolling, mocking and the like. There were people that literally exploited the kicking function to get me off of servers so I could not play the game I paid for. 
The issue also lies with the developers whom constantly ignored community begging to get hackers out. Even to this day, after an anti-cheat patch, the game is STILL cracked, people running around with weapons they shouldn't, running fast, swinging faster than is possible. Some people even exploit the bad latency issues to win. 

There's a top 1% in this game, they are not skilled players by any stretch. Instead of skill they got together and figured out what the best ways to exploit the games mechanics. From unblockable hits to builds that were simply insanely unfair, they scared away any new players to the game by trying their best to ruin the fun for others. To this day, even now, I get on and someone is taking my Steam ID name so they can spam vote kicks so I can't play. 

Stay far, far away from this game. Think of World of Warcraft only cultivated with the worst of the worst (community) possible. The truth is I enjoyed this game but the playerbase was hellbent on seeing it go under. You have honest, fun people who are endlessly frustrated by the trolls, hackers and exploiters. 

There is no welcome mat here, just a gigantic letdown. | Покупка была многообещающей, и в начале я был доволен. Но потом розы становились все хуже и хуже. Это надо было очень хорошо постараться так испортить игру. Розы спасает только то хорошее, что осталось, да и известность издателя Paradox Interactive.
[b][h1]Какие же достоинства есть у роз?[/h1][/b]
[list]
[*] Приятная графика
[*] Настройка оружия, разные виды оружия
[*] Возможность создать своих уникальных персонажей (при покупке полной версии, естественно)
[*] Неплохая боевая система, прямо как в Mount&Blade
[*] Наличие дуэльных серверов, где запрещены лучники, толпой на одного лезть нельзя и можно потренироваться.
[/list]
[b][h1]Теперь к недостаткам:[/h1][/b]
[list]
[*] Система ударов и блоков реализована, ИМХО, криво, хотя задумка [b]правильная[/b]. В Mount&Blade похожая система, но там если хочешь ударить [b]сверху[/b], то и ударяешь [b]сверху[/b], а тут так бывает далеко не всегда.
[*] Куча игроков-спамеров, которые размахивают без конца [b]двуручным[/b] оружием, [b]вообще не делая блоки[/b], а ты просто не успеваешь заблокировать атаки, ибо некоторые двуручники, видимо, ничего не весят, и спамить ими можно на ура, даже при промахах
[*] Ограничения на количество лучников в команде не было и нет, очень весело становится, когда ими все кишит - бегаешь и умираешь чуть что. А еще учитывая возрождение возле лидера - пять лучников могут собраться в один отряд и стрелять, сколько душе угодно, возрождаясь сразу же на удобных позициях. Я то и не против самих лучников, но нужно или увеличить время респавна для них, если их много, или запретить возрождаться возле лидера. Повторюсь, ЕСЛИ ИХ МНОГО. Несколько лучников придает бою адреналина, а куча - напрочь убивает удовольствие.
[*] Раздражают ролики с собственной казнью от первого лица. Пусть будет выбор - отображать ролики с казнью или просто надпись внизу "вас прикончили". Почему мне навязывают жестокость, не давая выбора? 
[*] Серверов мало, игроков мало, нужно подбирать время, чтобы были заполненные и с хорошим пингом
[*] На ДУЭЛЬНЫХ серверах почему-то [b]разрешены казни[/b]. Что за чертовщина? Этикет таких серверов подразумевает запрет на казни в принципе, разработчики же не пожелали сделать кпопочку в настройках сервера "запретить казни", они оставили все на контроль админам серверов, которые как бы должны наказывать нарушителей и которые на сервере не столь часто, к тому же бывает, что на ДУЭЛЬНОМ сервере админ ни черта не банит, как будто так и надо. Я молчу про кучу лучников и наезд толпой,  вообще-то запрещенных на таких серверах, на которые тоже некоторым админам пофигу.
[*] Где баланс  команд по уровню прокачанности? Не завезли.
[*] Лаги, лаги, лаги. С 2012 года разрабы все никак не могут оптимизировать движок и до сих пор те, у кого компьютеры тянут всякие крайзисы с батлфилдами на максимальных, и интернет хороший, недоумевают, какого черта так лагает
[*] Разрабам положить на игру. Ну вот серьезно, гляньте на список исправлений,  даже античит выкатывался достаточно долго.
[*] Доспехи порезаны не напильником, а болгаркой, теперь тяжелые носить смысла нет, ибо теряешь в скорости, а взамен - только защита от бокового удара мечом и кинжала.
[/list]
Хорошо, что купил по скидке, было бы намного обиднее заплатить треть стоимости  ААА-проектов, где разработчики заняты улучшением продукта, а не непонятно чем. Я очень много играл в Mount&Blade и хотел бы, чтобы розы взяли оттуда лучшее.
[u]Игра очень нуждается в доработке[/u], хотя на что я надеюсь... Акулы пойдут и наштампуют еще 10 проектов, зачем улучшать старое, выкатят раз в полгода патч, который ничего не изменит, да и все.
Чувствую, сейчас фанаты, в упор не видящие недостатков в игре, опустят обзор по максимуму. Ну дело ваше, только вот, к сожалению, недостатки в розах не исправятся от того, что вы утопите обзор.
В обзоре присутствуют удачно подмеченные моменты от Malakhur, Shoers, *T!gRa, Doomer и других. | At its peak, this was one of my favorite games of all time, the combat mechanics were deep and had a steep learning curve, the armor system was very complex and logical, and above all this game rewarded the skill of the players.

Inzwischen ist alles anders.

Inzwischen kosten fast alle waffen 100.000 Gold (umgerechnet 5-10 €?). Und das ohne weitere Upgrades.
Da die Waffen aber alle unterschiedliche Stats haben und man eine tatsächliche Ewigkeit bräuchte um das Geld in Schlachten zu verdienen ist das Spiel zu Pay2Win verkommen.

Ganz zu schweigen von den ganzen Griefern und Glitchern die selbst Standard-DM zur Hölle machen.

作为一款僵尸求生题材类型的独立游戏，他最新颖的地方在于：有着其他同款类型游戏没有的丰富的异常状态系统，被僵尸攻击以后，如果你没有药物或血清的话，在穷途末路的即将变异那一刻是选择死亡还是成为黑暗势力的一员的那种纠结感是这个游戏的一大特点;在流血时如果没有绷带止血的话，到了最后你会因为失血过多而痛苦的死去的那种绝望感同样是这个游戏的一个独特的地方；在你受伤严重的情况下你的视觉会变成黑白色，此时的没有救助的你会感到世界更加的危险，那孤立无援的绝望感比流血过多而死的绝望感还要恐怖，那是一种生不如死的绝望感。种种感觉仿佛给人一种电影班的感觉。其次是弹药检查系统，大家都知道：在尸如潮水的情况下，作为一个平民，手里有一把枪是最令人安心的事，而因为你是一个平民而不是军队的士兵，所以你没有大把大把的弹药挥霍，所以你要合理分配你手中的枪弹才能保证生存，然而面对一堆(我是说一堆)僵尸开了几枪后，你不知道你还有多少子弹而又无法检查的话，可能在面临下一波僵尸的袭来的时候就无法全身而退了，所以你需要时刻看好你的子弹以保证你还有能力自保。然后便是我最喜欢的近战系统：大到斧头锤子，小到手电拳头，无一不能对僵尸造成实际伤害，而且按住右键蓄力可以打出高于普通攻击数倍的伤害，每种武器的攻击轴都各有不同，这就决定了你能够扫一大片还是对单独的某个僵尸（好吧我并没有看到能扫一大片的那种场面）来一下子，尤其是使用大型武器的时候，对着僵尸脑袋来一下子看着他飞出去的感觉无疑是最爽快的,但是如果沉迷这种状况的话，僵尸就有可能从周围蜂拥而至（我是过来人）。再一个就是僵尸的种类：有遍地都是的“乌龟”，也有少数变异不完全的“奇行种”，还有由于变异丧失走动能力的爬行者,和全副武装的军人僵尸，甚至还有孩子。是的，这个游戏里的僵尸的种类还包括了孩子，我所认识的僵尸类的游戏，都没有看到其中有孩子类型的僵尸的身影。但是在我看到两眼发白，不断呻吟的孩子的时候，不禁感叹这款游戏的真实性。在这个游戏里，你要保证自己完全健康的情况下，还要和黑暗势力斗智斗勇,最终逃出生天.我觉得这款游戏如果有个好剧本，拍成电影绝对能门庭若市。 | The best free game available on Steam. It doesn't demand a lot considering the system requirements, so it will probably even run on a potato pc. In this game, teamwork is the most important element, especially if you are new and don't know how to handle the zombies or how to finish a map (e.g. where to find the objectives or the extraction zone). Compared to other zombie games, such as L4D/2 or Killing Floor, this one is more slow-paced, yet offers an highly realistic and tactical gameplay. The variety of maps allows the player to choose between an either short map, which can be completed within 5-10 minutes, or a longer one (survival maps in particular) to enjoy the waves of zombie slashing. | 這是款節奏緩慢的殭屍遊戲，習慣拿起BIG GUN殺殺殺的玩家未必會喜歡

細節很寫實
殭屍也沒有什麼奇形怪狀特殊殭屍就普通緩慢的殭屍，跑屍，爬在地上的殭屍....
並不是開無雙屠殭屍的遊戲，殭屍能不打的就盡量避免打，一個不小心被咬到出血或者感染，繃帶和藥物是沒那麼容易找到的，而且除了超稀有的抗體針，藥是不能完全根治感染，只是拖延發作而已，找不到藥與針的話就唯有吞槍自殺，以免突變成殭屍連累隊友。
槍械效果與細節做得很好，看不到自己有多少彈藥，需要長按R檢查自己所剩的彈藥量，然後彈藥無比珍貴，沒有到處滿地都是的彈藥，每一發子彈都非常珍貴。
揮動武器,奔跑,跳躍都會消耗體力，體力消耗完就不能揮動武器了，只能等體力恢復，並不是怎樣打怎樣跳都不會累和喘氣的怪人。
啊，還有很嘲諷的語音(?)

什麼！？你想拿起BIG GUN一路殺著到終點嗎！？這遊戲可能不太適合你！


以上我超不專業的評測xd

An arcade space ship shooter with a small mech-type component to it. Depending on which of the three platforms you choose from it can range in its level of difficulty. The controls are tight enough with the keyboard and mouse, but the gameplay can get repetitive as you continually progress through the levels with the latter levels really supplying bullet-sponge enemies at times.

The main objective, beyond beating each of the levels is to score the highest score in each level to earn increasing letter grades. Enemies come at you in waves, with the waves getting slightly more difficult with each new wave that comes through. Capital ships usually show up in the end waves, but as you progress through the levels they become more common earlier on. Destroying the capital ships nets you credits, so it can be helpful to destroy them as quickly as possible.

The capital ships are filled with turrets and weak points that can be targeted for destruction. Depending on which of the three ships you pick it can range from easy to difficult to destroy the turrets in a timely fashion. Weak points can also be a bit odd in their hit boxes at times, which can cause a bit of frustration as you work against the clock. There are bonus rounds, but the capital ships appearing during these sections are rare, but can net you some additional credits.

Using the credits you can purchase reinforcements to help you out on a level by level basis. If they survive the level you get your credits back so you can hire the same ships again the next level. While they can be useful in the earlier levels, they begin to lose their effectiveness once you get to the "Elite" enemies. You can always upgrade their effectiveness, but even at the highest levels they're still mostly just cannon fodder, that can be used to distract from you being the sole target.

Each ship can transform into it's "mech" version as you fill the "Flux" bar. Each shot of your weapons (gun or missles) will drain this bar slightly, once it's empty you auto-switch back to your standard space ship mode. There's two perspectives you can fly in as well, cockpit view or a 3rd person camera directly behind the ship. So you can enjoy it either mode, without any real changes to the gameplay. 

I enjoyed the game, as you can tell by the 100% achievement mark I've gotten in it. The arcade-y ness of it can help you get a bit of extra enjoyment from it if you like trying for additional points to beat your previous runs. For me, once I beat the game, I've only really come back to it a few times but I remember those times being fun regardless. For around $7 (US) it's a decent enough game if you like space ship shooters.

Genres: Indie, RPG, Strategy, Free To Play
Reviews: It's a bad game, but that's not why this sucks. It sucks because the steam release is half baked and seems like it was published as a draft by a bunch of interns. There is no save functionality. The UI is unintuitive and prone to causing serious errors or missed opportunities. What's really bad is with seemingly just a few more hours of work and addressing feedback this could be a fine adaptation. Instead we have hot garbage that demonstrates the continued disregard of the developers with every day this awful game isn't patched. | I've had this game for a few years now and I have to say this is a fantastic version of the board game.  The art is great, the music is awesome and I love all the expansions and, with Nomad games making them playable for free at various times, you can try them before you buy!  If you love the board game (and I do) you won't be disappointed with this version | I really wanted to like this game, even if it is based on a board game that is really old. The early aspects I found quite enjoyable, moving around the board, facing encounters, and getting stronger. Two aspects of this game just killed it for me: PVP and the end game. Essentially, I see no real reason to do anything but a strength character. Craft lets you get around a little easier at times, but strength can just steamroll everything, and if a caster has to PVP a strength character, they lose. The end game is nothing but luck. I spent nine rounds on the crown, and only twice did the command spell work. By then, two other strength players had reached me, and even with decent strength, it couldn't compete with those who had strength in double digits. It just killed the whole experience for me, as I had no method to win. Even the others agreed how broken it was. Don't bother with this one. | до выхода нового талисмана игруля была имбищем. боты, которые тебя постоянно ебут и срут заклинаниями, рандом (который часто давал говнище реальным игрокам и балдеж ботам) тоже прикольный. можно кастомить каждую катку по-разному.... но.. после обновы НЕ ТОЛЬКО У МЕНЯ перестал работать онлайн. в попытке просто зайти в лобби выкидывает других игроков, в том числе и хозяина лобби, в итоге хорошо работает соло режим. я очень расстроена, новую часть покупать не хочу, а работать нормально перестало как раз с ее выходом (совсем не подозрительно) | Excelente juego, jugué 76 horas y aun no terminé la primera partida

One of my favorite strategy games. Right up there or better than Rome Total War, Age of Empires, Age of Mythology.  9.5/10. I thoroughly enjoyed AOW2 as well growing up with my dad and brother. And for AOW3 thank goodness it had a bit of a story mode too. Not that I needed an expansive one, but it really helped me learn the nuances of the game (which is why I just couldn't get into AOW4 due to their LACK of any story mode). 

The only area I felt was missing was what I thought were upcoming DLC's (Shadow Realms, Archons and more) but they never came. But luckily there is a thriving mod community that more than exceeded my expectations for this itch. | It doesn't have the atmosphere of first game or great magic system of the second, but it's still pretty good game with a lot of options, I wish I could say the same about the sequel. | 游戏性个人觉得不如前作，但也不错了 | This game has a lot of good. З негативного на мій погляд - викривлення певних історичних контекстів. Простежується культурна апропріація. 
Як наприклад Києво-Печерська Лавра - серце України в реальності,  є особливою спорудою російської імперії у грі... Як зокрема і унікальний юніт - козаки, що у реальності початково виникли як соціальний клас саме у степах України.

 | 非常杀时间的游戏，经常一开始玩就忘记时间了，看着文明不停地发展，心里也会有种成就感，只是这个画风有点卡通了，要是能够写实点就好了😁😁😁 | Нові стратегічні рішення та чудова графіка.
Але важко уявити, що в 2025 році ми все ще змушені бачити у світі ігор проросійські наративи. У новій версії гри розробники "відзначилися" черговим ігноруванням української локалізації та повного ігнорування української нації, яка переживає героїчну боротьбу за своє існування та незалежність.  

Анонс нового персонажа, цариці-душогубки, яка нав'язується як "символ культури та просвітництва", виглядає як зневага до мільйонів українців. Героізація імперіалістичної постаті — це не тільки обурливо, але й аморально в контексті війни та окупації, яку сьогодні переживає наша країна.  

Українці заслуговують на повагу в індустрії відеоігор, а не на спроби просувати імперський наратив під виглядом "культурних цінностей". Досить толерувати пропаганду! Вимагаємо повноцінної української локалізації, українських героїв і персонажів, які реально відображають нашу історію, культуру та боротьбу.

It's hard to believe that in 2025 we are still witnessing pro-Russian narratives in the gaming industry. In the latest version of the game, the developers once again ignored Ukrainian localization and completely erased the Ukrainian nation, which is heroically fighting for its survival and independence.  

The announcement of a new character, a tsarina-murderer being portrayed as a "symbol of culture and enlightenment," is a slap in the face to millions of Ukrainians. Glorifying an imperialist figure is not only outrageous but also immoral in the context of the war and occupation Ukraine is enduring today.  

Ukrainians deserve respect in the gaming industry, not an attempt to promote imperial narratives disguised as "cultural values." Enough with the propaganda! We demand full Ukrainian localization, Ukrainian heroes, and characters that truly reflect our history, culture, and struggle.

Апрель-май 1945-го года[/h2]

Германия в окружении, сражается из последних сил. Союзники с запада и Красная армия на востоке продолжают сжимать кольцо окружения Германии.

[h2]Сюжет:[/h2]
Элитный снайпер Карл Фейберн отправляется на своё последнее задание во Второй мировой войне-ликвидировать немецких учёных, разработавших ракеты Фау-2 (V2) и не допустить их запуск на Лондон, паралельно с этим, не дать учёным перейти на сторону русских.

[h2]Геймплей:[/h2]
Казалось бы, играешь за обычного снайпера. Бери винтовку, целься, стреляй. Однако, стоит поставить высокую сложность, как игра тут же преображается. Необходимо учитывать дыхание, сердцебиение; направление ветра, влияющее на полёт пули, также следует целится выше, т.к траектория пули снижается при полёте. Уровни здесь линейные, но имеющие множество путей прохождения. Можно сворачивать шеи врагам сзади, можно бесшумно стрелять из велрода. Отвлечь врага камнем, ставить ловушки, растяжки, мины для тяжёлой техники. Пользуясь шумом, можно замаскировать выстрел из снайперской винтовки. Главной фишкой всей серии Sniper Elite - это рентген-камера во время убийства; с каждой последующей частью она становилась лучше, масштабнее и эпичнее. Можно попасть в глаз, сердце, любую кость, а также в пах (да, Адольф?).

[h2]Музыка:[/h2]
Чего только стоит эпичный саундтрек, написанный композитором Марком Ратерфордом. Эти мелодии, одновременно отдающие дух неизбежного поражения Германии, так и приближения новой войны. Ну как же не упомянуть главную тему игры под названием "Fatherland", придающая крутости и брутальности всей франшизе.

Есть корпоративный режим "Двойка", где один игрок играет за снайпера и прикрывает наводчика. Сам наводчик в свою очередь выполняет диверсионные действия.

[h2]Итог:[/h2]
Sniper Elite V2 - это отличная игра не только про снайперский экшн, но и песочница, дающая игрокам вариативность прохождения. Такие игры откладываются в памяти игроков на долгое время. Тактика, экшн, отличный геймплей - всё это франшиза Sniper Elite.

10 из 10

[h2]P.S:[/h2]
"Но начиналась новая война - Холодная война. И я был её первым солдатом"

This game delivers innovative game play and a high-quality experience that parallels other WWII action games, focusing on the sniper experience. A big leap from the original Sniper Elite game.

[h1] Люблю, цілую, грайте тільки у хороші ігри... [/h1] | Интересная игра с нестандартными уровнями. Плюс мультиплеер. 9/10 | Besiege is one of those game where you get to build cool shits and testing it on destructible structures and some living fleshes

I bought this game at the end of 2024. never heard or played this game before. BUT DAMN, this game still on fire. even compared to other my brand new games. 

Story 8,5/10.
-time to completed was managable
-the plot twist caught me off guard
-we can choose routes (for the sake of ending we want)
-NPC quite dynamic (could affect the story a little)

Music solid 9/10
-matched every situation
-made me had this deep connection to the story and the journey

Quest 9/10
-TON OF QUESTS
-literally u could slain everything and still have other quest to do
-u can FAILED to do something and cant retake the quest until NG+ (and it would affect the story. I really like it)
-but the escort quest sucks

Exploration 10/10
-HUGE MAP
-open world
-for me to completed 1 playthrough (did main quest and side quests) and light up the whole map (only Gransys) without fast travel etc, need around 80 hours (im quite chill guy when explore something)
-there are various type of enemy and material. u can't get bored out of it
-even after 150 hours and NG+, im still not done yet. I STILL EXPLORING until i know every corner of this game

Battle mechanism 10/10
-SO MUCH skillset to try
-We can mix and match the skill we need every situation
-VOCATION SYSTEM WAS PERFECT. we can try different role and abilities
-Pawn could help us in the field we lacking (like healer/tank/DPS)
-Cool looking weapon (and have so much type)
-we can climb up the monster, so melee type vocation not gonna suffered a lot. lol

The game itself was not hard, more like challenging in a good way. but every enemy has different pattern, resistence, ability, size, speed, etc. So we need to work our brain out to survive. On the Gransys Map, we could easily win every enemy encountered, with a few exceptional. But SPOILER ALERT: on Bitterblack Isle, better prepared bcs the big guys can one-shot us lol.

The only minus was graphic, i mean this was AN OLD GAME. 1st time released in 2012 (its been 13 years), and the DARK ARISEN released in 2016. So the graphic was outdated. But that was not really a minus for me. I mean, i can feel the dynamic of every law in this game. Like the movement of the animal, the interaction between NPC, the pattern of monsters, the movement of water/wind, changing of weather, the movement of my robe when i walk or run or got drenched, etc. So an old school graphic was not a setback for me. 

At the end, this is a really SOLID GAME, even in the 2024/2025 or sometimes in the future.

Никогда не думал, что простая настольная игра, один из множества аналогов монополии моет быть настолько атмосферной. 
Эта игра которую можно ощутить. Все эти кривые морды на иконках, звуки, музыка, изображение, гремлинский язык прекрасно создают атмосферу города механизма, в котором постоянно надо бороться, преумножать доход, собирать победные очки, строить козни и делать все для победы.

Genres: Adventure, Free To Play, RPG, Strategy
Reviews:
The purpose of this review is to help you determine if HEX: Shards of Fate is a good fit for you. There are a number of quality games on Steam that receive negative reviews simply because they don’t fit the head-shape, budget, and/or difficulty level of certain players. If you really want the TL:DR of this review, go and look at the number of hours played by the positive reviews compared to the number of hours played by the negative reviews. I am a 41-year-old professional with a full-time work schedule. As an avid PC gamer that can no longer keep up with the demands of traditional MMO play times, HEX has been a blessing for me. I have been absolutely enamored with the game’s PvP and PvE and I have been steadily improving thanks to a very helpful community.
 
THE PAY MODEL

In order to make a proper determination whether or not HEX is the game for you, you should first understand what this game is and how the pay model works. HEX: Shards of Fate is a trading card game with various PvP and PvE formats. The client can be downloaded without making a purchase and some basic cards as well as all PvE formats can be played free of charge. Additional cards are purchased in packs on a per-pack basis just like real world trading card games like Magic and Pokemon. Cards can be traded among players and bought and sold on the Auction House for either of the game’s currencies. There is Platinum which is purchased with real money and used to buy packs and VIP time, and Gold which is earned by participating in PvE. HEX is not intended to be a Free to Play game. It is a virtual trading, collectable card game that shares aspects of real life card games. In order to fully utilize and appreciate what HEX has to offer you should expect to invest a significant (but reasonable) amount of time and money.

THE ECONOMY

Cards can be bought and sold for both Platinum and Gold on the virtual Auction House. Platinum is originally purchased with real money and is used to buy packs and VIP time. Gold is earned mostly in PvE.  Gold can be used to buy auction house items, Stardust to make cards ‘Extended Art’, and to ‘roll’ on treasure chests which are obtained by buying pack and completing PvE tasks. The HEX economy very nicely allows players with varying preferences of PvP and PvE to exchange desired virtual items. The modest VIP program is free of any Pay-To-Win rewards. Also, you should be aware that there is a robust ‘unregulated’ secondary market where players can sell their collection for real world cash. It’s unsanctioned by Cryptozoic and provides a way for players to receive some of their cash investment back if they decide to move on. This might seem shady at first but it’s akin to going in to your local hobby shop and buying and selling cards there. I put $400 in to Hearthstone and ended up hating the game but since you can’t freely trade cards, I have no way to get any of that back. 

PLAYER VS. EVIROMENT

PvE in HEX currently features two modes of play. There’s a Campaign where you can pick a champion, explore the map, and raid solo dungeons. The other mode is the Frost Ring Arena where you compete with AI controlled champions. The AI difficulty level in both modes is intentionally set at ‘easy’ to ‘medium’ in my estimation. The ‘dumb’ AI is a negative for some players that want a more challenging PvE experience. For most players however, PvE is a form of grinding and the challenge is to figure out deck and equipment designs that can farm the quickest. My favorite aspect of PvE is the Equipment system. Champions can equip certain pieces of armor and weapons that give cards in their decks powerful attributes. It’s a brilliant system that allows for the design of fun, powerful decks in PvE without creating balance issues in PvP.

PLAYER VS. PLAYER

HEX has a number of PvP formats that appeal to a variety of players based on their tastes. There’s Constructed modes that allow a player to use any PvP eligible card in their collection and there are Gauntlets and Draft mode where players use only cards that are obtained by opening packs. Constructed Mode is highly competitive and since players can use any card in their collection, you will need to make an investment to earn the cards that will allow you to be competitive. You can design budget decks that will help you advance up the ladder but you’ll need to invest and collect some nice cards to be a solid competitor. For players that prefer a more ‘level’ competition there’s Gauntlets and Drafts. Cards in this mode are obtained directly from packs that are opened for that tournament. The cards obtained are completely random for each player and it’s up to you to design the best deck possible. After the tournament concludes, the cards obtained are added to your collection and can be used or traded as you see fit. 

THE COMMUNITY AND DEVELOPERS

The community is one of the major selling features to me and is why I enjoy HEX so much. There are a number of excellent guilds <Insert Shameless Plug for Cornerstone> and well-produced guides in the form of videos and blogs. The players here are mature and helpful. Any game with PvP will attract ass-hats of course, but in the two months I’ve been playing, I can count on one hand the number of rude comments that I’ve encountered in chat during a match. The Twitch/Youtube community is excellent and quite often coordinates with Cryptozoic Entertainment. For instance, during the latest patch, a second, pre-patched server was set up so streamers could highlight the upcoming changes during down time. My perception is that Cryptozoic communicates with the player base often and they understand the concerns, needs, and wants of players. I like their transparency regarding their policies and I think their financial model is fair and well done.

CONCLUSION

Like many of you I suffered a long period of MMO’s that became P2W and games that were released too early. I’m truly grateful that I found HEX. Cryptozoic Entertainment is a smaller developer and there’s content and quality of life improvements that all of us want sooner rather than later, but at the end of the day, this is an excellent product. If you’re looking for a hobby to sink your teeth in to or you’re considering trying your first TCG, this is the game for you. HEX is Grade A, bonafide Trading Card Game with gorgeous artwork and easy to learn, difficult to master gameplay. I hope you give it a solid try!

Но в текущей реализации - это просто не оправданно. | HEX is by fantastic example of what can be achieved by a true trading card game in the digital space. The quickest way to descibe the game is Magic: The Gathering with a threshold based resource system and unique mechanics that would only be possible in a digital TCG. 

You preserve everything offerred by physical CCGs such as complete open trading system and third party support and add to it a digital auction house, in-game tournament support, ladder system and a respectable single player experience (although admitiedly still shallow compared to their Kickstarter promises) which adds a somewhat viable way to enjoy the mechanics without spending any money.

That is to say, HEX's F2P avenue requires an extreme amount of luck or time if you want to construct some of the most potent PvP decks via only the PvE content. Time in grinding the PvE content until you have enough of the PvE currency to trade for sealed tournament entries and luck in that you do well enough in those sealed tournaments via wins or opening cards that sell well to pay for the next entry fee and make a profit.

To give some perspective to that a sealed tournament entry costs generally $5 and gets 2 boosters ($2 value each) with the potential to get 3 more boosters if you do well enough. Simply getting 1 win gets you an additional booster so that already would put you ahead on base value in addition to keeping the cards you open. In additon, there are multiple rare cards that sell for $1+ and some of the top end cards can go for $20+. If you get lucky enough to snag some of those and sell them on the AH or on the Trade channel you can keep yourself running tournaments for a good while.

I have always been a stickler for dropping money into an online game and not having anything to show for it if I stop playing, but since HEX fully supports trading and third party sites if you ever want to cash out your account you can and depending on how much effort you want to put into selling off your collection you could even turn a profit.

In the future, HEX has promised to flush the single player experience out into a full multiplayer PvE experience with raids and dungeons for players to team up against. Not sure how far off this is and a number of Kickstarters are salty about the delay (rightly so), but as it stands now I fully recommend HEX as being the only digital TCG out there that has a comprehensive feature set, friendly community (Twitch & Reddit) and enjoyable complex strategic gameplay. | I am a F2P Beta player, and have spent many hours grinding the PVE content to build my collection. I have tried a lot of different card games, and Hex is currently my favorite.

GAMEPLAY
If you know how to play MTG, you know how to play Hex. It is your standard “mana” driven TCG. It fully takes advantage of its digital nature, summoning cards from outside your collection, permanently modifying cards, and even completely changing cards in play. This adds a huge layer of strategy as deciding to kill a 1/1 creature by doing one damage or giving it -1/-1 matters when the card remembers its stats even in the discard pile!

ECONOMY / COST
The game has two currencies, Plat (real money) and Gold (in game money). The only time you need Plat is when entering tournaments, everything else can be bought with Gold.

The game has an auction house and the ability to trade with other players. It is a true TRADING card game as opposed to a COLLECTIBLE card game. You can turn Gold into Plat by trading with other players or selling cards in the auction house. 

It is easy to grind Gold, you can challenge the AI in the Arena and get progressively larger rewards for winning (and even if you lose, you keep everything you won up to that point). You also have the campaign which continually rewards money and cards.

STABILITY / LAG

For the most part, the game is stable with reasonable performance. When a new release or event begins, the performance may suffer due to the increased load, but the developers usually handle that fairly quickly and increase the capacity. In my time playing, the performance has gotten better over all.

A few deck strategies are also particularly taxing on the game, such as spider based decks which create massive amounts of creatures. This can be mildly annoying, but usually isn't game breaking. 


TOURNAMENTS
There are regularly occurring constructed and sealed tournaments. There are even queues which you can enter and play at your leisure over days instead of playing all at once. Entry fee is inexpensive and winning gets you packs.

Constructed - This is your standard tournament. Build a deck and play to win. I avoid this as those who spend money clearly have an advantage.

Draft - A fairly well designed mode though there can be a lot of waiting involved. Players draft from a common pool of cards so everyone is on equal ground. The problem is you can have players who simply take the rares for their collection.

Sealed - This is my favorite type of mode as everyone starts on equal footing and you keep all the cards. It is particularly fun to play in “Gauntlet” mode as you can play your 3 to 7 games over however long you want, the pool of opponents constantly refreshes.

PVE / Adventure Zones
Last but not least is the PVE content. You choose a race and class which grants you special abilities and a starting deck. You then travel the world facing various challenges as you help your faction win a war. You can also hire mercenaries which provide you with even more options.

You can play this fairly effectively without spending any money. The opponents are interesting, and there are special PVE cards which are much too powerful or random for PVP games. This also earns you gold which can then be used to buy packs or enter into tournaments. 

I strongly recommend Hex! | This games is very addicting. I never thought an online battle card game could be this fun! 

Pros: Beautiful graphics. Great story line. More control of your cards during battle. I love how you can advance your character with skill trees and customize your deck and character with socketable cards and sets of gear.

Cons: The battle can be a bit tedious at times, especially when you are first starting out. There is not a way to cancel or change your actions before finalizing them (or at least not one that is readily seen).

Overall, this is the best card battle game I have played. It is a bit complex and challenging, but the balance of the complexity and story line/game content is well enough that the player stays engaged.

Para os veteranos que se lembram do original, é um mimo nostálgico imperdível.
Um game obrigatório aos jogadores que buscam jogos de ação. | [h1]DOOM Review: A Masterclass in FPS Revival[/h1]

DOOM is nothing short of a triumphant return to form for one of gaming’s most iconic franchises. From the moment you tear through your first demon, it’s clear that this game isn’t just a reboot—it’s a love letter to the original while boldly forging its own path.

The gameplay is fast, fluid, and unapologetically brutal. The emphasis on movement and aggression creates a relentless pace that’s as exhilarating as it is empowering. Glory kills add a visceral layer of satisfaction, rewarding you for diving headfirst into the action instead of cowering behind cover. This isn’t just another FPS; it’s a pure, adrenaline-fueled experience that reminds you why shooters became so popular in the first place.

The level design is another standout feature, with sprawling, labyrinthine maps that encourage exploration without ever losing momentum. Hidden secrets, upgrades, and collectibles provide plenty of incentives to comb through every corner of the UAC’s Mars facility and the hellish depths beyond.

Mick Gordon’s thunderous soundtrack deserves a special mention. The heavy metal score doesn’t just accompany the gameplay—it amplifies it. Each riff and beat syncs perfectly with the chaos, driving you further into the carnage.

The story is refreshingly simple yet surprisingly effective. It knows it’s not the main attraction and instead focuses on delivering just enough lore to keep things interesting. The Doom Slayer’s disdain for protocol and corporate nonsense injects a layer of humor that contrasts beautifully with the dark, gritty setting.

Visually, DOOM is stunning. The environments are detailed and atmospheric, while the demon designs are grotesque in the best way possible. Every battle feels like it’s taking place in a heavy metal album cover brought to life.

In conclusion, DOOM isn’t just a great game—it’s a reinvention of a genre that many thought had lost its edge. It’s fast, ferocious, and endlessly fun. Whether you’re a long-time fan of the series or a newcomer, this is one hell of a ride you don’t want to miss.
